articles.title: 2024 NFL mock draft: First-round projections ahead of free-agency
articles.author: Vincent Parise
articles.excerpt: With free agency upon us, here's our latest NFL mock draft with first-round projections.
articles.summary:
NFL free agency is upon us, which means teams around the league are set to welcome some new additions to the roster.
For the Chicago Bears, they're getting ready to let the NFL world know of their decision at quarterback. They are either going to keep Justin Fields or move on and select one (likely Caleb Williams) with the first overall pick in the 2024 NFL draft.
The expectation is Chicago will trade Fields, but free agency will be key in providing a market for a partner. The Pittsburgh Steelers, a team believed to be itnerested in Fields, are out of the running after recently signing Russell Wilson. Baker Mayfield is back with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, which is great news for the Bears. 
But all eyes will be on Kirk Cousins, who's garnering plenty of interest from the Atlanta Facons. If Cousins re-signs with the Minnesota Vikings, the Falcons will be a top suitor for Fields.
Free agency kicks off this week, and it will impact decision-making at the draft as teams address some current needs.
With that in mind, here's our current first-round projections as free agency gets underway:

LOS ANGELES, CALIFORNIA – NOVEMBER 18: Caleb Williams #13 of the USC Trojans passes the ball during the first half of a game against the UCLA Bruins at United Airlines Field at the Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum on November 18, 2023 in Los Angeles, California. (Photo by Sean M. Haffey/Getty Images)
The Chicago Bears select Caleb Williams with the number one overall pick. There is no free agent out there better than the ceiling of Williams coming out of USC. 

Nov 25, 2023; Raleigh, North Carolina, USA; North Carolina Tar Heels quarterback Drake Maye (10) throws a pass against the North Carolina State Wolfpack during the first half at Carter-Finley Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Rob Kinnan-USA TODAY Sports
The Washington Commanders select Drake Maye out of North Carolina. They have their long-term solution at the QB position. 

Nov 18, 2023; Baton Rouge, Louisiana, USA; Heisman Trophy candidate LSU Tigers quarterback Jayden Daniels (5) warms up before their game against the Georgia State Panthers at Tiger Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Matthew Dobbins-USA TODAY Sports
The New England Patriots select Jayden Daniels out of LSU. They don't waste their time in free agency as it is time for them to make another attempt at developing a long-term answer. 

Sep 23, 2023; South Bend, Indiana, USA; Ohio State Buckeyes wide receiver Marvin Harrison Jr. (18) tries to come up with the catch against Notre Dame Fighting Irish cornerback Benjamin Morrison (20) but draws a penalty during the second quarter of their game at Notre Dame Stadium.
The Arizona Cardinals give Kyler Murray an amazing weapon by drafting Marvin Harrison Jr. out of Ohio State. He is going to be a big part of their offense for a very long time. 

Malik Nabers 8 as the LSU Tigers take on Texas A&M in Tiger Stadium in Baton Rouge, Louisiana, November 25, 2023.
The Los Angeles Chargers select Malik Nabers out of LSU. He is going to make some incredible plays with Justin Herbert for a long time. 

Jan 1, 2024; New Orleans, LA, USA; Washington Huskies wide receiver Rome Odunze (1) warms up before playing against the Texas Longhorns in the 2024 Sugar Bowl college football playoff semifinal game at Caesars Superdome. Mandatory Credit: John David Mercer-USA TODAY Sports
The New York Giants select Rome Odunze from Washington. The dynamic playmaking receiver is New York's last hope of getting something special out of Daniel Jones. 

EVANSTON, ILLINOIS – SEPTEMBER 30: Olumuyiwa Fashanu #74 of the Penn State Nittany Lions in action against the Northwestern Wildcats during the second half at Ryan Field on September 30, 2023 in Evanston, Illinois. (Photo by Michael Reaves/Getty Images)
The Titans select Olu Fashanu out of Penn State. This organization is very good at developing linemen and Fashanu will do great things for them. 

Dec 2, 2023; Atlanta, GA, USA; Alabama Crimson Tide linebacker Dallas Turner (15) celebrates after a sack in the second quarter against the Georgia Bulldogs in the SEC Championship at Mercedes-Benz Stadium. Mandatory Credit: John David Mercer-USA TODAY Sports
The Atlanta Falcons select Dallas Turner. They usually like drafting skilled offensive players in the first round but this year sees them grab a very good pass rusher. 

Jan 1, 2022; Glendale, Arizona, USA; Notre Dame Fighting Irish offensive lineman Joe Alt (76) against the Oklahoma State Cowboys in the 2022 Fiesta Bowl at State Farm Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-USA TODAY Sports
The Chicago Bears use their selection to draft Joe Alt out of Notre Dame. He is a fantastic lineman who should be incredible once he comes to the NFL. The Bears offense is well on its way now. 

Oct 28, 2023; Tucson, Arizona, USA; Oregon State Beavers offensive lineman Taliese Fuaga #75 walks off the field against the Arizona Wildcats at Arizona Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Zachary BonDurant-USA TODAY Sports
The New York Jets need help on the offensive line so they take Taliese Fuaga out of Oregon State. He will boost their group right away. 

Michigan quarterback J.J. McCarthy warms up before the national championship game at NRG Stadium in Houston on Monday, Jan. 8, 2024.
The Minnesota Vikings currently need help at the quarterback position because Kirk Cousins is set to hit free agency. They shock the world and select JJ McCarthy out of Michigan 11th overall.

Sep 23, 2023; Tuscaloosa, Alabama, USA; Alabama Crimson Tide defensive back Terrion Arnold (3) carries the ball after an interception against the Mississippi Rebels during the second half of a football game at Bryant-Denny Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Butch Dill-USA TODAY Sports
The Denver Broncos address their defense by drafting Terrion Arnold out of Alabama. He will help their secondary. 

Michael Wade/Icon Sportswire via Getty Images
The Las Vegas Raiders select Quinton Mitchell out of Toledo. This dynamic defensive back will help them in every way. 

Aug 27, 2022; Tallahassee, Florida, USA; Florida State Seminoles defensive end Jared Verse (5) lines up against Duquesne Dukes offensive lineman Chris Oliver (59) during the first half at Doak S. Campbell Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Melina Myers-USA TODAY Sports
The New Orleans Saints need some help with their pass rushing. That is why they select Jared Verse out of Florida State. 

Georgia tight end Brock Bowers (19) scores a touchdown during the second half of a NCAA college football game against Ole Miss in Athens, Ga., on Saturday, Nov. 11, 2023. Georgia won 52-17.
Anthony Richardson could use some help on the offense. Tight end Brock Bowers out of Georgia fell a little bit and the Indianapolis Colts are thankful. Lots of teams will regret that. 

Nov 18, 2023; Ames, Iowa, USA; Texas Longhorns defensive lineman Byron Murphy II (90) celebrates sacking the Iowa State Cyclones quarterback during the game at Jack Trice Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Aaron E. Martinez-USA TODAY Sports
The Seattle Seahawks select Byron Murphy II out of Texas. He will be a great asset to their defensive line. 

Sep 9, 2023; San Diego, California, USA; UCLA Bruins defensive lineman Laiatu Latu (15) battles against San Diego State Aztecs tight end Mark Redman (81) during the first half at Snapdragon Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Orlando Ramirez-USA TODAY Sports
Laiatu Latu out of UCLA will be a great edge rusher for the Jacksonville Jaguars after they make him the 17th overall pick. 

Sep 4, 2021; Atlanta, Georgia, USA; Alabama Crimson Tide offensive lineman JC Latham (65) blocks against the Miami Hurricanes at Mercedes-Benz Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Dale Zanine-USA TODAY Sports
Joe Burrow needs more protection so the Cincinnati Bengals select offensive tackle JC Latham out of Alabama. 

Jan 9, 2023; Inglewood, CA, USA; Georgia Bulldogs offensive lineman Amarius Mims (65) against the TCU Horned Frogs during the CFP national championship game at SoFi Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-USA TODAY Sports
The Los Angeles Rams make it back-to-back SEC tackles drafted when they take Georgia star Amarius Mims.

Nov 25, 2023; Columbia, South Carolina, USA; Clemson Tigers cornerback Nate Wiggins (2) smiles after breaking up a pass to South Carolina wide receiver Nyck Harbor (8) during the fourth quarter at Williams-Brice Stadium. Clemson won 16-7. Mandatory Credit: Ken Ruinard-USA TODAY Sports
The Pittsburgh Steelers are proud to welcome Nate Wiggins out of Clemson. One of the fastest players in the draft will be a great asset to them. 

Oct 14, 2023; Seattle, Washington, USA; Oregon Ducks offensive lineman Jackson Powers-Johnson (58) celebrates after the Ducks scored a touchdown against the Washington Huskies during the second half at Alaska Airlines Field at Husky Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Steven Bisig-USA TODAY Sports
Jackson Powers-Johnson is going to be a great center for the Miami Dolphins as long as he stays healthy. He will prove to be a great 21st-overall pick. 

Dec 1, 2023; Las Vegas, NV, USA; Washington Huskies offensive lineman Troy Fautanu (55) celebrates after the Huskies scored against the Oregon Ducks during the first quarter at Allegiant Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Stephen R. Sylvanie-USA TODAY Sports
Jason Kelce has retired, so it is time for the Eagles to try and draft his replacement. They go for Troy Fautanu out of Washington in hopes that he can be an NFL center. There are big shoes to fill there.

Penn State defensive end Chop Robinson (44) celebrates after sacking Massachusetts quarterback Taisun Phommachanh in the first half of a NCAA football game Saturday, Oct. 14, 2023, in State College, Pa. The Nittany Lions won, 63-0.
The Houston Texans select Chop Robinson out of Penn State. This edge rusher will look great on the same attack as Will Anderson Jr. 

Oct 28, 2023; Lawrence, Kansas, USA; Oklahoma Sooners offensive lineman Tyler Guyton (60) at the line of scrimmage against the Kansas Jayhawks during the game at David Booth Kansas Memorial Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Denny Medley-USA TODAY Sports
The Dallas Cowboys are a good team but can't get it done in the playoffs. They try to get over the hump with Tyler Guyton at 24th overall. 

Oct 21, 2023; Iowa City, Iowa, USA; Iowa Hawkeyes defensive back Cooper DeJean (3) looks on during the game against the Minnesota Golden Gophers at Kinnick Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Jeffrey Becker-USA TODAY Sports
The Green Bay Packers select Cooper DeJean out of Iowa 25th overall. Chicago Bears fans dislike him already. 

Nov 11, 2023; Chapel Hill, North Carolina, USA; Duke Blue Devils offensive lineman Graham Barton (62) before the game at Kenan Memorial Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Bob Donnan-USA TODAY Sports
After bringing back a large portion of their offense when some thought they might not, the Tampa Bay Buccaneers select offensive lineman Graham Barton out of Duke.

Dec 31, 2022; New Orleans, LA, USA; Alabama Crimson Tide defensive back Kool-Aid McKinstry (1) reacts after a defensive play against the Kansas State Wildcats during the second half in the 2022 Sugar Bowl at Caesars Superdome. Mandatory Credit: Andrew Wevers-USA TODAY Sports
The Arizona Cardinals got an elite player at fourth overall and now they add a star defensive back with cornerback Kool-Aid McKinstry out of Alabama. 

Brian Thomas Jr 11 runs the ball as the LSU Tigers take on Texas A&M in Tiger Stadium in Baton Rouge, Louisiana, November 25, 2023.
The Buffalo Bills may or may not have Stefon Diggs in 2024. They prepare for that reality by selecting Brian Thomas Jr. out of LSU. 

Sep 30, 2023; Nashville, Tennessee, USA; Missouri Tigers defensive back Ennis Rakestraw Jr. (2) tackles Vanderbilt Commodores tight end Justin Ball (84) after a made catch during the first half at FirstBank Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Steve Roberts-USA TODAY Sports
The Detroit Lions try to keep the good vibes going by selecting Ennis Rakestraw Jr. from Mizzou to join their secondary. 

Nov 6, 2021; Minneapolis, Minnesota, USA; Illinois Fighting Illini defensive lineman Jer'Zhan Newton (94) reacts to a missed stop in the third quarter at Huntington Bank Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Matt Krohn-USA TODAY Sports
The Baltimore Ravens would probably have two or three more Super Bowls if it weren't for Tom Brady and Patrick Mahomes. They will try to improve their rushing of quarterbacks by selecting Jer'Zhan Newton out of Illinois. 

Oct 8, 2022; Tucson, Arizona, USA; Arizona Wildcats offensive lineman Jordan Morgan (77) against the Oregon Ducks at Arizona Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-USA TODAY Sports
The San Francisco 49ers select Jordan Morgan. You could never go wrong with a high-end offensive lineman. 

Sep 10, 2022; Austin, Texas, USA; Texas Longhorns wide receiver Xavier Worthy (8) catches a pass and lands out of bounds in the end zone against the Alabama Crimson Tide during the first half at Darrell K Royal-Texas Memorial Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Scott Wachter-USA TODAY Sports
Xavier Worthy is arguably the fastest player in this draft. The Kansas City Chiefs can afford to take risks and they do so by selecting this wide receiver, a position they desperately need help with, out of Texas.

articles.title: 2024 NFL mock draft: QBs dominate post-free agency projections
articles.author: Vincent Parise
articles.excerpt: With the first wave of free agency in the books, here are our updated first-round projections, where plenty of QB dominoes fall.
articles.summary:
The NFL offseason is in full swing following the first wave of free agency. Sometimes, the offseason is just as exciting as the regular season. Every team currently has hope and belief that they can do what they need to do to become a playoff team.
The 2024 NFL draft, now that free agency has had a lot of dominos fall, is the next way that teams will look to improve their rosters. There will be a ton of elite prospects heading to new cities to compete for jobs so they can try and be impactful.
The Chicago Bears control the draft because they have the No. 1 overall pick. They went 7-10 in 2023, which is a big step forward from their 3-14 season a year prior. They have that number one pick from the Carolina Panthers, who gave it to them from a trade involving the 2023 first overall selection.
Through free agency and trades, Chicago has set themselves up for a big move here with this top pick, which everyone knows will be a quarterback at this point. But who will they select at No. 9? What will the teams before and after them do? This is what the first round may look like knowing what we know after the first wave of free agency:
LOS ANGELES, CALIFORNIA – NOVEMBER 18: Caleb Williams #13 of the USC Trojans passes the ball during the first half of a game against the UCLA Bruins at United Airlines Field at the Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum on November 18, 2023 in Los Angeles, California. (Photo by Sean M. Haffey/Getty Images)
The Chicago Bears traded Justin Fields to the Pittsburgh Steelers. Now, it's all but a guarantee that they select Caleb Williams with the No. 1 pick.
Nov 25, 2023; Raleigh, North Carolina, USA; North Carolina Tar Heels quarterback Drake Maye (10) throws a pass against the North Carolina State Wolfpack during the first half at Carter-Finley Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Rob Kinnan-USA TODAY Sports
With the Bears taking Caleb Williams, the Washington Commanders are going to have to settle on Drake Maye at No. 2.
Nov 18, 2023; Baton Rouge, Louisiana, USA; Heisman Trophy candidate LSU Tigers quarterback Jayden Daniels (5) warms up before their game against the Georgia State Panthers at Tiger Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Matthew Dobbins-USA TODAY Sports
Jayden Daniels may surprise some people with his great play when the New England Patriots selected him as the No. 3 overall pick.
Sep 23, 2023; South Bend, Indiana, USA; Ohio State Buckeyes wide receiver Marvin Harrison Jr. (18) tries to come up with the catch against Notre Dame Fighting Irish cornerback Benjamin Morrison (20) but draws a penalty during the second quarter of their game at Notre Dame Stadium.
With quarterbacks going 1-2-3, the Arizona Cardinals land Marvin Harrison Jr. at No. 4. He will be a great weapon for Kyler Murray.
Malik Nabers 8 as the LSU Tigers take on Texas A&M in Tiger Stadium in Baton Rouge, Louisiana, November 25, 2023.
The Los Angeles Chargers will make it two LSU players taken in the top five when they select Malik Nabers with the fifth overall pick. After trading Keenan Allen, they need some help at receiver.
Jan 1, 2024; New Orleans, LA, USA; Washington Huskies wide receiver Rome Odunze (1) warms up before playing against the Texas Longhorns in the 2024 Sugar Bowl college football playoff semifinal game at Caesars Superdome. Mandatory Credit: John David Mercer-USA TODAY Sports
With the sixth overall pick, the New York Giants add to their receiver room with Rome Odunze. He will help their offense be more dynamic.
Sep 9, 2023; Raleigh, North Carolina, USA; Notre Dame Fighting Irish tackle Joe Alt (76) during the first half at Carter-Finley Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Rob Kinnan-USA TODAY Sports
Following an influx of quarterbacks and receivers, Joe Alt falls to the Tennessee Titans at No. 7. He'll be perfect for them and they're very good at developing good linemen.
EVANSTON, ILLINOIS – SEPTEMBER 30: Olumuyiwa Fashanu #74 of the Penn State Nittany Lions in action against the Northwestern Wildcats during the second half at Ryan Field on September 30, 2023 in Evanston, Illinois. (Photo by)
The Atlanta Falcons need to protect Kirk Cousins so he can utilize all of his weapons. They start that by drafting Penn State's Olu Fashanuwith the eighth overall pick.
Dec 2, 2023; Atlanta, GA, USA; Alabama Crimson Tide linebacker Dallas Turner (15) celebrates after a sack in the second quarter against the Georgia Bulldogs in the SEC Championship at Mercedes-Benz Stadium. Mandatory Credit: John David Mercer-USA TODAY Sports
The Bears improve their pass rush by drafting Dallas Turner with the ninth overall pick. He will serve as a great complement opposite Montez Sweat.
Oct 28, 2023; Tucson, Arizona, USA; Oregon State Beavers offensive lineman Taliese Fuaga #75 walks off the field against the Arizona Wildcats at Arizona Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Zachary BonDurant-USA TODAY Sports
The New York Jets desperately need help with their offensive line. They address it by selecting Taliese Fuaga at No. 10.
Michigan quarterback J.J. McCarthy warms up before the national championship game at NRG Stadium in Houston on Monday, Jan. 8, 2024.
The Minnesota Vikings are looking to replace Kirk Cousins, so they make the move to draft Michigan's J.J. McCarthy at No. 11. It might surprise some people, but the defending National Champion has proven that he is a winner.
Michael Wade/Icon Sportswire via Getty Images
The Denver Broncos boost their secondary by drafting cornerbacknQuinyon Mitchell with the 12th overall pick in the draft.
Nov 25, 2023; Columbia, South Carolina, USA; Clemson Tigers cornerback Nate Wiggins (2) smiles after breaking up a pass to South Carolina wide receiver Nyck Harbor (8) during the fourth quarter at Williams-Brice Stadium. Clemson won 16-7. Mandatory Credit: Ken Ruinard-USA TODAY Sports
The Las Vegas Raiders also shore up their secondary with the addition of Clemson cornerback Nate Wiggins at 13th overall.
Sep 4, 2021; Atlanta, Georgia, USA; Alabama Crimson Tide offensive lineman JC Latham (65) blocks against the Miami Hurricanes at Mercedes-Benz Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Dale Zanine-USA TODAY Sports
Alabama tackle JC Latham will be a great addition for the New Orleans Saints when they take him 14th overall.
Georgia tight end Brock Bowers (19) scores a touchdown during the second half of a NCAA college football game against Ole Miss in Athens, Ga., on Saturday, Nov. 11, 2023. Georgia won 52-17.
A lot of teams will prioritize other positions, but Brock Bowers is one of the best players in this draft. The Indianapolis Colts steal him here at No. 15.
Nov 18, 2023; Ames, Iowa, USA; Texas Longhorns defensive lineman Byron Murphy II (90) celebrates sacking the Iowa State Cyclones quarterback during the game at Jack Trice Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Aaron E. Martinez-USA TODAY Sports
The Seattle Seahawks always seem to build a great defense. They are hoping that Byron Murphy II becomes their next great player at No. 16.
Sep 9, 2023; San Diego, California, USA; UCLA Bruins defensive lineman Laiatu Latu (15) battles against San Diego State Aztecs tight end Mark Redman (81) during the first half at Snapdragon Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Orlando Ramirez-USA TODAY Sports
The Jacksonville Jaguars have to be better next season after a down 2023 season. Laiatu Latu should help them improve their pass rush at 17th overall.
Jan 9, 2023; Inglewood, CA, USA; Georgia Bulldogs offensive lineman Amarius Mims (65) against the TCU Horned Frogs during the CFP national championship game at SoFi Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-USA TODAY Sports
Joe Burrow needs some more protection. Georgia tackle Amarius Mims will help when the Cincinnati Bengals take him at 18th overall.
Oct 14, 2023; Tallahassee, Florida, USA; Florida State Seminoles defensive end Jared Verse (5) against the Syracuse Orange during the first half at Doak S. Campbell Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Melina Myers-USA TODAY Sports
With Aaron Donald retiring, the Los Angeles Rams are going to be targeting a good pass rusher. They get a good one with Jared Verse at 19th overall.
Sep 23, 2023; Tuscaloosa, Alabama, USA; Alabama Crimson Tide defensive back Terrion Arnold (3) carries the ball after an interception against the Mississippi Rebels during the second half of a football game at Bryant-Denny Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Butch Dill-USA TODAY Sports
The Pittsburgh Steelers draft Terrion Arnold at No. 20 overall to help boost their secondary.
Dec 1, 2023; Las Vegas, NV, USA; Washington Huskies offensive lineman Troy Fautanu (55) celebrates after the Huskies scored against the Oregon Ducks during the first quarter at Allegiant Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Stephen R. Sylvanie-USA TODAY Sports
The Miami Dolphins add a versatile offensive lineman by selecting Troy Fautanu with the 21st overall pick.
Oct 14, 2023; Seattle, Washington, USA; Oregon Ducks offensive lineman Jackson Powers-Johnson (58) celebrates after the Ducks scored a touchdown against the Washington Huskies during the second half at Alaska Airlines Field at Husky Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Steven Bisig-USA TODAY Sports
The Philadelphia Eagles take a chance at replacing Jason Kelce by drafting Jackson Powers-Johnson out of Oregon. It may take a while for him to develop into a star center, but the Eagles have to be thinking about that now.
Oct 21, 2023; Iowa City, Iowa, USA; Iowa Hawkeyes defensive back Cooper DeJean (3) looks on during the game against the Minnesota Golden Gophers at Kinnick Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Jeffrey Becker-USA TODAY Sports
The Minnesota Vikings look to improve their defensive secondary by adding in Cooper DeJean with the 23rd overall pick.
Nov 6, 2021; Minneapolis, Minnesota, USA; Illinois Fighting Illini defensive lineman Jer'Zhan Newton (94) reacts to a missed stop in the third quarter at Huntington Bank Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Matt Krohn-USA TODAY Sports
The Dallas Cowboys add to their defense again with defensive tackle Jer'Zhan Newton at 24th overall.
Brian Thomas Jr 11 runs the ball as the LSU Tigers take on Texas A&M in Tiger Stadium in Baton Rouge, Louisiana, November 25, 2023.
The LSU Tigers had their QB and WR1 already drafted. Well, the Green Bay Packers get a stud with their WR2 in Brian Thomas Jr. Getting Jordan Love another weapon with the 25th overall pick will help them.
Dec 31, 2022; New Orleans, LA, USA; Alabama Crimson Tide defensive back Kool-Aid McKinstry (1) reacts after a defensive play against the Kansas State Wildcats during the second half in the 2022 Sugar Bowl at Caesars Superdome. Mandatory Credit: Andrew Wevers-USA TODAY Sports
The Tampa Bay Buccaneers take Alabama cornerback Kool-Aid McKinstry with the 26th overall pick to help shore up their secondary.
Nov 11, 2023; Chapel Hill, North Carolina, USA; Duke Blue Devils offensive lineman Graham Barton (62) before the game at Kenan Memorial Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Bob Donnan-USA TODAY Sports
The Arizona Cardinals continue to build around Kyler Murray. After adding Marvin Harrison Jr. earlier in the draft, they give him some protection with Duke's Graham Barton.
Penn State defensive end Chop Robinson (44) celebrates after sacking Massachusetts quarterback Taisun Phommachanh in the first half of a NCAA football game Saturday, Oct. 14, 2023, in State College, Pa. The Nittany Lions won, 63-0.
The Buffalo Bills improve their defense by adding Penn State' s Chop Robinson with the 28th overall pick.
Oct 28, 2023; Lawrence, Kansas, USA; Oklahoma Sooners offensive lineman Tyler Guyton (60) at the line of scrimmage against the Kansas Jayhawks during the game at David Booth Kansas Memorial Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Denny Medley-USA TODAY Sports
The Detroit Lions add to their offensive line depth by drafting Tyler Guyton out of Oklahoma with the 29th overall pick.
Nov 25, 2023; Tempe, Arizona, USA; Arizona Wildcats offensive lineman Jordan Morgan (77) against the Arizona State Sun Devils during the Territorial Cup at Mountain America Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-USA TODAY Sports
Jordan Morgan will help shore up the Baltimore Ravens' offensive line which will be incredibly important based on how much value they have in their running game with Lamar Jackson being joined by Derrick Henry.
Dec 29, 2023; Arlington, TX, USA; Missouri Tigers defensive lineman Darius Robinson (6) reacts during the first quarter against the Ohio State Buckeyes at AT&T Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Kevin Jairaj-USA TODAY Sports
The San Francisco 49ers don't have many holes. They take Darius Robinson out of Missouri with the 31st overall pick so they can develop him as a pass rusher.
Texas Longhorns wide receiver Adonai Mitchell (5) catches the ball for an first down against Kansas State Wildcats cornerback Jacob Parrish (10) in the. First quarter of an NCAA college football game, Saturday, November. 4, 2023, in Austin, Texas.
The Kansas City Chiefs are the Super Bowl champions. What do the champs do in the draft? Well, they address a need that was glaring despite their winning season. Everybody knows that Patrick Mahomes needs another receiver to rely on going forward. Adding someone like Adonai Mitchell out of Texas is the play with that 32nd overall pick.

articles.title: Winners (the Pac-12) and losers (Gonzaga) of the NCAA women's basketball committee's top-16 reveal
articles.author: Mitchell Northam
articles.excerpt: Yes, UConn is projected to go to the Albany regional. No, that will not change.
articles.summary:
There are many ways in which women's college basketball is different than the men's game. When it comes to the NCAA Tournament, there is one especially glaring difference.
While the men play their entire tournament at neutral sites, the top 16 seeds in the women's field get to host games on the first weekend. Which means, if you have a really good season, you'll get to play your first two tournament games on your home court, making a top 16 seed incredibly valuable and something that teams strive for.
This month, the selection committee for the women's NCAA Tournament unveils their top 16 seeds twice, giving a fans a glimpse into what they're thinking, what they value, and where teams would be seeded if the season ended at that moment.
We got our first top 16 reveal on Thursday night before Caitlin Clark continued her pursuit of the all-time scoring record. Here's the seed list:
If the tournament started today, these would be the top 16 teams in the bracket!#NCAAWBB pic.twitter.com/jPC1c0rwKB
— NCAA March Madness (@MarchMadnessWBB) February 15, 2024

With that, let's take a look at some winners and losers from the reveal.
Dec 30, 2023; Los Angeles, California, USA; USC Trojans guard JuJu Watkins (12) watches a shot in the second half against the UCLA Bruins at Pauley Pavilion presented by Wescom. Mandatory Credit: Jayne Kamin-Oncea-USA TODAY Sports
It's the last season of the Pac-12 as we know it and the conference is absolutely going out with a bang. It has stars like JuJu Watkins and Alissa Pili, stacked teams like Stanford and UCLA, and squads you can't overlook like Oregon State. Before this league splinters apart, its playing some of its best basketball.
The committee is currently forecasting that the Pac-12 will have five teams hosting first weekend games, the most of any conference. Stanford and Colorado are projected to earn No. 1 seeds, UCLA is a 2-seed, and USC and Oregon State are 3-seeds. While some might argue that the ACC is the deepest conference, the Pac-12 is heavy at the top.
Stanford is the highest seeded Pac-12 team and for good reason. The Cardinal are No. 2 overall in NET and are 7-3 against teams in the top 25 of the NET – which is the most wins any team in the country has against the NET top 25.
If you're wondering why Colorado is the team that joined Stanford on the 1-line, it's because the Buffs don't have any bad losses. They've fallen to N.C. State, UCLA and Oregon State, all teams in the top 25 of the NET. The teams right behind the Buffs in the seeding order – Iowa and N.C. State – have losses outside of the top 25, to Nebraska and Miami, respectively.
4-6 should be Iowa, NC State, Colorado otherwise I agree with this https://t.co/8eeFgAvJ7s
— Christian Jackson (@cjack67) February 15, 2024

March 7, 2023; Las Vegas, NV, USA; Gonzaga Bulldogs guard Kaylynne Truong (14) celebrates against the Portland Pilots during the first half in the finals of the WCC Basketball Championships at Orleans Arena. Mandatory Credit: Kyle Terada-USA TODAY Sports
Projections released Thursday morning by The Athletic and HerHoopStats had the Zags hosting first-round games. The Bulldogs' resume is impressive. They are 24-2 and on an 18-game win streak, they own wins over Stanford, South Dakota State and Arizona, and their only losses came on the road in overtime at Washington State, and on a neutral court to Louisville. Gonzaga is 9-0 against teams ranked 51 to 100 in the NET – which is the best mark of that sort in the country – and they're 3-2 against teams in the top 50 of the NET.
Simply put, Gonzaga deserves to host. Again – this team beat Stanford! By double digits!
The Bulldogs are 11th in NET, ninth in HerHoopsStats rating and have been ranked in the AP Top 25 Poll for the majority of the season.
That Gonzaga wasn't in the top 16 of this reveal feels like a slight towards mid-majors.
Some folks will say the Bulldogs need to schedule tougher, but they played against five Power 5 opponents in the non-conference slate and beat three of them. What more can the Zags do?
Zags are currently riding a 18 game winning streak, 24-2 overall, ranked No. 11 in the net, are 4-2 in Quad 1 and 6-0 in Quad 2, and beat one of the No. 1 seeds on there (Stanford) by 20 points.
But sure, they aren't one of the top 16 teams in the country https://t.co/I2uXYZ6Csl
— Another Gonzaga Blog (@AnotherZagsBlog) February 15, 2024

South Carolina head coach Dawn Staley calls out from the bench in the first half an NCAA college basketball game against LSU in Baton Rouge, La., Thursday, Jan. 25, 2024. (AP Photo/Gerald Herbert) ORG XMIT: LAGH
The Gamecocks seem to have the No. 1 overall seed on lock. Here's what Lisa Peterson, the chair of the committee, said during the reveal show on ESPN: 'The gap between one and two is very big. The gap between two through five is very small.'
In short: South Carolina, right now, looks to be head and shoulders above the rest of the field. And indeed, Dawn Staley's team is the lone undefeated team left in the country.
The Gamecocks have played just three games this year where they haven't won by double-digits: Utah, North Carolina and LSU – each of which was either on the road or on a neutral court.
Even if South Carolina loses a game or two between now and March 17, it's hard to argue against the Gamecocks being the top seed.
Feb 7, 2024; Hartford, Connecticut, USA; UConn Huskies head coach Geno Auriemma wins his 1200th game after defeating the Seton Hall Pirates at XL Center. Mandatory Credit: David Butler II-USA TODAY Sports
Women's basketball fans, I have something to tell you:
There is not a scenario in which the committee will send UConn to one of the two Portland regionals. The Huskies could be seeded second, fourth or sixth. It doesn't matter. They are going to Albany.
Any year that there is a regional based in the northeastern U.S., that is where the Huskies will go. Just ask N.C. State, a No. 1 seed in 2022 that had to face No. 2 UConn in Bridgeport in the Elite Eight.
This year, that is going to be true for a few reasons. One, UConn has an incredibly passionate, large and loyal fanbase, and Albany is about two hours and 15 minutes from UConn's campus. The city of Albany and the NCAA are counting on UConn fans to buy tickets, to pack the stands, to stay in hotels, to spend money at restaurants. Secondly, with South Carolina being the No. 1 overall seed in the Albany 1 region, do you really think the committee is going to pass up the opportunity to have the Huskies and Gamecocks meet in the Elite Eight for a rematch? Those TV ratings will break records, and after all, the NCAA Tournament is a television show.
As for the folks complaining about Oregon State getting to play in Portland, committee chair Lisa Peterson said as long as a team hasn't played more than three regular season games at a regional site, they can be sent there.
Also: take it easy on the Beavers. They're getting left behind in the splintering Pac-12. They deserve a break.
IDC IDC IDC…UConn should not be in the Albany regional. Oregon St should not be in Portland. Idc what number they are in seeding, but a 3 seed should not have any type of homecourt advantage in the S16 and possibly the E8. pic.twitter.com/76jdXn7YLt
— Somewhere between COZY and ALIEN SUPERSTAR! (@yanab0015) February 15, 2024

articles.title: Ranking Big Ten football teams by highest 2024 ceiling
articles.author: Ben Kenney
articles.excerpt: What should we expect from Wisconsin football in 2024?
articles.summary:
Only 169 days remain until Wisconsin opens its 2024 football season at home against Western Michigan.
It's a big year for the Badgers as Luke Fickell works to improve the program after a 7-6 2023 campaign. There was some coaching staff turnover this offseason, plus new faces including QB Tyler Van Dyke entering from the transfer portal. Whether it's just another year of continuity in Fickell and Mike Tressel's defense and Phil Longo's offense, or tangible upgrades in talent on the field, the chance is increasingly likely that 2024 is a better year than 2023.
Related: Where Wisconsin QB Tyler Van Dyke falls on Fanduel's 2024 Heisman Trophy odds
But Wisconsin's place in the new Big Ten is unknown. Oregon, Washington, USC and UCLA enter a new conference structure that has every program desperate to find solid footing. 2024 will be a big year to see how the new structure shakes out.
Looking ahead to the season, we've already ranked all 18 programs in the Big Ten, ranked the 18 starting quarterbacks, ranked all 18 head coaches, predicted each Big Ten team's 2024 record, looked at the early College Football Playoff tiers, made bold predictions for the season and checked in on the Las Vegas win totals for each team in the conference.
Now, it's time to rank the 2024 Big Ten teams based on 2024 potential:



Indiana's newly announced head coach of football Curt Cignetti speaks to the media on Friday, Dec. 1, 2023. Credit: Rich Janzaruk/Herald-Times-USA TODAY NETWORK
New head coach Curt Cignetti faces a tough first year at Indiana. The Hoosiers return a solid chunk of their 2023 production, and face one of the easier conference schedules in the Big Ten. But it's been a rough few years since 2020, and Cignetti should need a few years to build the program back up.
Ceiling: Five wins


Nov 4, 2023; Chicago, Illinois, USA; Northwestern Wildcats head coach David Braun looks on during the first half against the Iowa Hawkeyes at Wrigley Field. Mandatory Credit: David Banks-USA TODAY Sports
Like Indiana, Northwestern's team talent composite is too low to expect anything big from the team this season. It should be generally competitive, but without the Big Ten West, a Big Ten Championship appearance seems nearly impossible.
Ceiling: Five wins


Nov 18, 2023; Evanston, Illinois, USA; Purdue Boilermakers head coach Ryan Walters watches his team play against the Northwestern Wildcats in the fourth quarter at Ryan Field. Mandatory Credit: Jamie Sabau-USA TODAY Sports
Purdue has the lowest win total in the conference and faces one of the Big Ten's toughest schedules. The team can't be last because Hudson Card has the chance to pop, but Purdue's 2024 potential is low.
Ceiling: Six wins


Feb 13, 2024; Los Angeles, CA, USA; DeShaun Foster answers questions from media after he was introduced as the UCLA Bruins head football coach during a press conference at Pauley Pavilion. Mandatory Credit: Jayne Kamin-Oncea-USA TODAY Sports
DeShaun Foster should enter his first season at UCLA with tempered expectations. The Bruins face the conference's fourth-toughest schedule while needing to break in QB Ethan Garbers and install OC Eric Bieniemy's new offense. There is some potential for a big season, but I'd expect more inconsistency week-to-week as it enters the new Big Ten.
Ceiling: Seven wins


Oct 21, 2023; Iowa City, Iowa, USA; Minnesota Golden Gophers head coach P.J. Fleck watches a replay against the Iowa Hawkeyes during the first quarter at Kinnick Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Jeffrey Becker-USA TODAY Sports
UCLA likely has a better team than Minnesota, and the Gophers are set against the conference's second-toughest schedule. But I have to give the nod to some of the older Big Ten schools that are used to the week-to-week grind of the conference. Minnesota may struggle, it also may return to 2019 form.
Ceiling: Eight wins


CHAMPAIGN, ILLINOIS – OCTOBER 21: Head coach Bret Bielema of the Illinois Fighting Illini protests a call during the second half against the Wisconsin Badgers at Memorial Stadium on October 21, 2023 in Champaign, Illinois. (Photo by Michael Hickey/Getty Images)
Copy every thought on Minnesota and paste it here for Illinois. The schedule is tough, but if QB Luke Altmyer can make a big jump and Bielema's defense return to its 2022 form, the Fighting Illini could rise toward the second tier of the conference.
Ceiling: Eight wins


Sep 3, 2023; Piscataway, New Jersey, USA; Rutgers Scarlet Knights head coach Greg Schiano before the game against the Northwestern Wildcats at SHI Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Vincent Carchietta-USA TODAY Sports
Rutgers isn't usually high on this list, but the 2024 Scarlet Knights nearly lead the nation in returning production and face the conference's easiest schedule. Will it contend for the Big Ten title? Likely not. But the circumstances of the season point toward a ceiling we aren't used to seeing a Rutgers team have.
Ceiling: Eight wins


Oct 28, 2023; Evanston, Illinois, USA; Maryland Terrapins head coach Mike Locksley (center) on the sidelines during the second half at Ryan Field. Mandatory Credit: David Banks-USA TODAY Sports
This certainly feels like Maryland's permanent place on this list. It will be decisively better than the bad teams, but also not close to the conference's best.
Ceiling: Nine wins


Oct 14, 2023; Madison, Wisconsin, USA; Iowa Hawkeyes head coach Kirk Ferentz looks on during warmups prior to the game against the Wisconsin Badgers at Camp Randall Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Jeff Hanisch-USA TODAY Sports
Here's the problem with Iowa: its floor is so consistently high, regardless of how bad the offense is. But the ceiling isn't that high either. The best-case scenario is it scratches out 10 wins again but isn't competitive for the conference title.
Ceiling: Nine wins


Michigan State's new football coach Jonathan Smith waves to the crowd during a timeout in the basketball game against Georgia Southern on Tuesday, Nov. 28, 2023, at the Breslin Center in East Lansing. Credit: Nick King/Lansing State Journal-USA TODAY NETWORK
Michigan State is a classic low-floor, high-ceiling team in 2024. Jonathan Smith has work to do in his first year as head coach, but if young QB Aidan Chiles hits immediately and a few other things fall into place, it could finish in the conference's second tier.
Ceiling: 10 wins


Dec 1, 2023; Las Vegas, NV, USA; Washington Huskies mascot Harry the Husky and cheerleaders pose after the Pac-12 Championship game against the Oregon Ducks at Allegiant Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Kirby Lee-USA TODAY Sports
This list is based on 2024 potential, not 2023 results. So although the team just played for a national title, it moves into 2024 with the Big Ten's toughest schedule, almost zero returning production and new coaches everywhere. This is a far different Washington team that will not contend to win the Big Ten.
Ceiling: 10 wins, Big Ten Championship game


Nov 11, 2023; University Park, Pennsylvania, USA; Michigan Wolverines offensive line coach Sherrone Moore reacts while being interviewed with running back Blake Corum (2) following a game against the Penn State Nittany Lions at Beaver Stadium. Michigan won 24-15. Mandatory Credit: Matthew O'Haren-USA TODAY Sports
Take every word about Washington and apply it to Michigan. New coach, new quarterback and almost zero returning production from last year's National Championship-winning team. It's Michigan, so a Big Ten title is possible. But this should be a year of tempered expectations for Wolverines fans.
Ceiling: 10 wins, Big Ten Championship game


Dec 27, 2022; Phoenix, Arizona, USA; Wisconsin Badgers defensive end Gio Paez (94) with head coach Luke Fickell against the Oklahoma State Cowboys in the 2022 Guaranteed Rate Bowl at Chase Field. Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-USA TODAY Sports
Wisconsin has a lower win total and faces a gauntlet schedule. But in terms of ceiling, things clicking for Luke Fickell in his second year could mean one of the conference's best offenses paired with a solid defensive group. There is a remote possibility that the Badgers could win the Big Ten, believe it or not.
Ceiling: 10 wins, Big Ten title


Nov 11, 2023; Lincoln, Nebraska, USA; Nebraska Cornhuskers head coach Matt Rhule during the third quarter against the Maryland Terrapins at Memorial Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Dylan Widger-USA TODAY Sports
Nebraska has the following going for it in 2024: one of the Big Ten's easiest schedules, an incoming five-star quarterback, the nation's No. 3 returning production after having a fantastic defense. The Cornhuskers' one problem in 2023 was quarterback — enter top recruit Dylan Raiola.
Matt Rhule could win the Big Ten this season.
Ceiling: 11 wins, Big Ten title


USC Trojans quarterback Caleb Williams (13) talks with USC Trojans head coach Lincoln Riley during the first half of the game against No. 6 Oregon Ducks on Saturday, Nov. 11, 2023, at Autzen Stadium in Eugene, Ore. Credit: Abigail Dollins-USA TODAY NETWORK
USC has real work to do on defense as it enters the new Big Ten, but any list without a Lincoln Riley team near the top is foolish. New quarterback Miller Moss should continue the team's offensive excellence, it'll all be about whether USC can get stops. But this team can easily win the Big Ten in 2024.
Ceiling: 12 wins, National Championship game


Dec 30, 2023; Atlanta, GA, USA; Penn State Nittany Lions head coach James Franklin on the sidelines against the Mississippi Rebels during the second half at Mercedes-Benz Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Dale Zanine-USA TODAY Sports
2023 should've been the year for Penn State to finally win the Big Ten again. But the 2024 team still has a high ceiling with good returning production including another year for quarterback Drew Allar. the Nittany Lions are a national title contender if they can somehow get past Ohio State and Michigan.
Ceiling: 12 wins, National Championship game


Dec 29, 2023; Arlington, Texas, USA; Ohio State Buckeyes head coach Ryan Day walks off the field after losing 14-3 to Missouri Tigers in the Goodyear Cotton Bowl Classic at AT&T Stadium. Credit: Kyle Robertson/Columbus Dispatch-USA TODAY NETWORK
Ohio State's ceiling is winning a National Championship — it would've had one in 2022 if its kicker had made the last-second field goal against Georgia. But it can't be No. 1 on this list because of its quarterback situation. Kansas State transfer Will Howard should be fine, but he isn't the Heisman contender Ohio State may need at the position.
Ceiling: 12 wins, National Champions


Nov 18, 2023; Tempe, Arizona, USA; Oregon Ducks head coach Dan Lanning (center) leads quarterback Bo Nix (10) and Ty Thompson (13) onto the field for the game against the Arizona State Sun Devils at Mountain America Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-USA TODAY Sports
Oregon isn't only the favorite in the Big Ten, it's one of the National Championship favorites entering the season. The ceiling is as high as it possibly can be.
Ceiling: 12 wins, National Champions

Contact/Follow @TheBadgersWire on X (formerly Twitter), and like our page on Facebook to follow ongoing coverage of Wisconsin Badgers news, notes, and opinion. Follow Ben Kenney on X.

BRACKET MADNESS: Enter USA TODAY's NCAA tournament bracket contest, create a pool and invite your friends!

articles.title: Every former Wisconsin Badger who has played in the Super Bowl since 2000
articles.author: Ben Kenney
articles.excerpt: Can you name all of them?
articles.summary:
We have reached another year's edition of the big game. This time, it's Patrick Mahomes and the Kansas City Chiefs against Christian McCaffery and the San Francisco 49ers.
While former Wisconsin Badgers are not the headliners for this contest, and they rarely are, there is one who will play a prominent role in this edition: Chiefs starting inside linebacker Leo Chenal.
That's actually been the case for many Super Bowls. The Wisconsin products aren't on the front page of the preview or winning MVP, but players like James White (14 catches, 110 receiving yards, 3 touchdowns in Super Bowl 51), Corey Clement (four catches, 100 receiving yards in Super Bowl 52) and numerous lineman have all been key pieces in Super Bowl victories.
For those names and a few others who may have been forgotten, here is every former Wisconsin Badger to have played in the Super Bowl since 2000:
Jan 28, 2001; Tampa, FL, USA; FILE PHOTO; New York Giants receiver Ron Dixon (86) scores on a 97 yard kickoff return as Baltimore Ravens kicker Matt Stover (3) chases during Super Bowl XXXV. The Ravens defeated the Giants 34-7 at Raymond James Stadium. Mandatory Credit: USA TODAY Sports
Giants: Pete Monty, Ron Dayne and Derek Engler
Baltimore Ravens won 34-7
Jan 26, 2003; San Diego, CA, USA; FILE PHOTO; Tamp Bay Buccaneers running back Michael Pittman (32) carries the ball against the Oakland Raiders during Super Bowl XXXVII at Qualcomm Stadium. The Bucs defeated the Raiders 48-21. Mandatory Credit: MPS-USA TODAY Sports
Buccaneers: Aaron Stecker
Tampa Bay Buccaneers won 48-21
Feb 4, 2007; Miami, FL, USA; Indianapolis Colts running back Dominic Rhodes (33) jumps over Chicago Bears (55) Lance Briggs while being hit by Charles Tillman (33) in the third quarter of Super Bowl XLI at Dolphins Stadium. The Colts beat the Bears 29-17. Mandatory Credit: Matthew Emmons-USA TODAY Sports Copyright © 2007 Matthew Emmons
Colts: Jim Sorgi
Indianapolis Colts won 29-17
Feb 7, 2010; Miami, FL, USA; New Orleans Saints cornerback Tracy Porter (22) runs an interception for a touchdown against the Indianapolis Colts during the fourth quarter of Super Bowl XLIV at Sun Life Stadium. The Saints won 31-17. Mandatory Credit: Steve Mitchell-USA TODAY Sports
Saints: Jonathan Casillas
New Orleans Saints won 31-17
Feb 5, 2012; Indianapolis, IN, USA; New York Giants wide receiver Mario Manningham (82) makes a catch in front of New England Patriots free safety Sterling Moore (29) during the second half of Super Bowl XLVI at Lucas Oil Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-USA TODAY Sports
Giants: Travis Beckum
New York Giants won 21-17
Feb 2, 2014; East Rutherford, NJ, USA; Seattle Seahawks outside linebacker Malcolm Smith (53), center, runs after recovering a fumble against the Denver Broncos in the third quarter in Super Bowl XLVIII at MetLife Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Ed Mulholland-USA TODAY Sports
Broncos: Montee Ball
Seahawks: Chris Maragos, O'Brien Schofield, Russell Wilson
Seattle Seahawks won 43-8
Feb 1, 2015; Glendale, AZ, USA; New England Patriots strong safety Malcolm Butler (21) celebrates with teammates after intercepting a pass against the Seattle Seahawks in the fourth quarter in Super Bowl XLIX at University of Phoenix Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-USA TODAY Sports
Seahawks: Russell Wilson, O'Brien Schofield
Patriots: Jonathan Casillas, James White (not active)
New England won 28-24
Feb 7, 2016; Santa Clara, CA, USA; Denver Broncos inside linebacker Danny Trevathan (59) reacts after recovering a fumble against the Carolina Panthers during the second quarter in Super Bowl 50 at Levi's Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Kelley L Cox-USA TODAY Sports
Broncos: Owen Daniels
Denver Broncos won 24-10
Feb 5, 2017; Houston, TX, USA; New England Patriots running back James White (28) runs the ball against the Atlanta Falcons in overtime during Super Bowl LI at NRG Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-USA TODAY Sports
Patriots: James White
New England won 34-28
Feb 4, 2018; Minneapolis, MN, USA; Philadelphia Eagles running back Corey Clement (30) celebrates his third quarter touchdown against the New England Patriots in Super Bowl LII at U.S. Bank Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Matthew Emmons-USA TODAY Sports
Eagles: Corey Clement, Beau Allen, Chris Maragos (not active)
Patriots: James White
Philadelphia Eagles won 41-33
Feb 3, 2019; Atlanta, GA, USA; New England Patriots running back James White (28) against Los Angeles Rams linebacker Mark Barron (26) in Super Bowl LIII at Mercedes-Benz Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-USA TODAY Sports
Patriots: James White
Rams: Rob Havenstein
New England Patriots won 13-3
Feb 7, 2021; Tampa, FL, USA; Tampa Bay Buccaneers quarterback Tom Brady (12) throws in the pocket against the Kansas City Chiefs in Super Bowl LV at Raymond James Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Matthew Emmons-USA TODAY Sports
Buccaneers: Jack Cichy (not active)
Tampa Bay Buccaneers won 31-9
Los Angeles Rams quarterback Matthew Stafford (9) is hit as he throws by Cincinnati Bengals nose tackle D.J. Reader (98) in the third quarter during Super Bowl 56, Sunday, Feb. 13, 2022, at SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, Calif. The Cincinnati Bengals lost, 23-20.
Rams: David Edwards, Rob Havenstein
Los Angeles Rams won
Kansas City Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes (15) escapes a tackle attempt by Philadelphia Eagles linebacker Haason Reddick (7) during the first quarter in Super Bowl LVII at State Farm Stadium in Glendale on Feb. 12, 2023.Nfl Super Bowl Lvii Kansas City Chiefs Vs Philadelphia Eagles
Chiefs: Leo Chenal
Eagles: T.J. Edwards
Kansas City Chiefs won 38-35
Feb 5, 2024; Las Vegas, NV, USA; San Francisco 49ers quarterback Brock Purdy (13) and Kansas City Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes (15) stand on stage together during Super Bowl LVIII Opening Night at Allegiant Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Kirby Lee-USA TODAY Sports
Chiefs: Leo Chenal

articles.title: Which Big Ten football team has the toughest conference schedule in 2024?
articles.author: Ben Kenney
articles.excerpt: Wisconsin hosts Alabama, USC faces LSU and Michigan meets Texas. Then begins the conference schedule, which is filled with big-time
articles.summary:
The Big Ten football season is going to look different in 2024.
New additions USC, UCLA, Oregon and Washington bring more formidable opponents to the table. But more importantly, gone is the East-West Division model, replaced by a format of conference standings similar to that in basketball.
There are some blockbuster out-of-conference games to monitor before the conference slate begins this fall. Wisconsin hosts Alabama, USC faces LSU and Michigan meets Texas. Then begins the conference schedule, which is filled with big-time matchups every weekend.
So far this offseason we've already ranked all 18 programs in the Big Ten, ranked the 18 head coaches, predicted each Big Ten team's 2024 record and checked in on the Las Vegas win totals for each team in the conference.
Now it's time to take a look at each team's 2024 conference schedule:
So, to rank each program's 2024 Big Ten schedule as we preview the 2024 season we've taken each team's ESPN SP+ rating and found numerical values for every game, and therefore every schedule.
The equation is simple. Every opponent's SP+ rating is added together to find a Total Opponent Score. That large number is then divided by the nine conference games to find the Average Opponent Score — a number that can then be compared to the SP+ leaderboard to find the average quality of team each schedule contains.
Here is how each program's 2024 Big Ten Conference schedule ranks, from easiest to most challenging:
Contact/Follow @TheBadgersWire on X (formerly Twitter), and like our page on Facebook to follow ongoing coverage of Wisconsin Badgers news, notes, and opinion. Follow Ben Kenney on X.
