articles.title: 2024 NFL Mock Draft: Offense dominates top-10 in our latest first-round projections
articles.author: Vincent Parise
articles.excerpt: Quarterbacks go 1-2-3 and offense accounts for nine of the top 10 picks in our latest 2024 NFL mock draft.
articles.summary:
The 2024 NFL draft is going to be a big one for Chicago Bears fans. Ahead of it, we should know whether or not they are going to trade Justin Fields or select a quarterback with the No. 1 pick acquired from the Carolina Panthers last offseason.
There are going to be a lot of twists and turns in the media between now and then. There are still some who believe the Bears are going to stick with Fields and a lot of people who think Caleb Williams is coming to Chicago. (But it sounds like we should get a good idea of their plans sooner than later).
Outside of that, there are a lot of other compelling stories that will come from this draft. That includes the Bears also having the No. 9 overall pick. Who will they take with that selection? That may depend on the decision made at No. 1. 
As far as other teams go, the headlines will write themselves. Who is going to draft a quarterback? Where is stud Marvin Harrison Jr. going to land? Which receivers are going to follow him? These are all questions that will be answered on April 25. 
Here's a look at our latest first-round mock draft projections, where quarterbacks go 1-2-3 and offense dominates nine of the top 10 selections.

LOS ANGELES, CALIFORNIA – NOVEMBER 18: Caleb Williams #13 of the USC Trojans passes the ball during the first half of a game against the UCLA Bruins at United Airlines Field at the Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum on November 18, 2023 in Los Angeles, California. (Photo by Sean M. Haffey/Getty Images)
The Chicago Bears move on from Justin Fields and select USC superstar Caleb Williams. It is a new era under center in Chicago (again). 

Nov 25, 2023; Raleigh, North Carolina, USA; North Carolina Tar Heels quarterback Drake Maye (10) throws a pass against the North Carolina State Wolfpack during the first half at Carter-Finley Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Rob Kinnan-USA TODAY Sports
It is time for the Washington Commanders to move on from Sam Howell. With Williams going to Chicago, it is Drake Maye's time in the nation's capital. 

Nov 18, 2023; Baton Rouge, Louisiana, USA; Heisman Trophy candidate LSU Tigers quarterback Jayden Daniels (5) warms up before their game against the Georgia State Panthers at Tiger Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Matthew Dobbins-USA TODAY Sports
Tom Brady is gone. Bill Belichick is gone. It is time for Jayden Daniels with the New England Patriots. They select him third overall out of LSU. 

Sep 23, 2023; South Bend, Indiana, USA; Ohio State Buckeyes wide receiver Marvin Harrison Jr. (18) tries to come up with the catch against Notre Dame Fighting Irish cornerback Benjamin Morrison (20) but draws a penalty during the second quarter of their game at Notre Dame Stadium.
There is a chance that Marvin Harrison Jr. is the best player at his position in the 2024 NFL draft. The Arizona Cardinals decide to keep Kyler Murray and select the superstar wideout with pick No. 4.

Georgia tight end Brock Bowers (19) scores a touchdown during the second half of a NCAA college football game against Ole Miss in Athens, Ga., on Saturday, Nov. 11, 2023. Georgia won 52-17.
We know that the Los Angeles Chargers need to surround Justin Herbert with a playoff-caliber team. They do that by drafting Brock Bowers with the fifth overall pick. 

Malik Nabers 8 as the LSU Tigers take on Texas A&M in Tiger Stadium in Baton Rouge, Louisiana, November 25, 2023.
With the sixth overall pick, the New York Giants select Malik Nabers. We don't know who their QB is going to be in the long term, but they will have a great young receiver to throw to. 

Dec 2, 2023; Atlanta, GA, USA; Alabama Crimson Tide linebacker Dallas Turner (15) celebrates after a sack in the second quarter against the Georgia Bulldogs in the SEC Championship at Mercedes-Benz Stadium. Mandatory Credit: John David Mercer-USA TODAY Sports
The Tennessee Titans shore up their pass rush by selecting Dallas Turner with the seventh overall pick. He could help improve their defense right away. 

Jan 1, 2022; Glendale, Arizona, USA; Notre Dame Fighting Irish offensive lineman Joe Alt (76) against the Oklahoma State Cowboys in the 2022 Fiesta Bowl at State Farm Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-USA TODAY Sports
Joe Alt is the best offensive lineman in this draft class. The Atlanta Falcons take him with the seventh overall pick.

Jan 1, 2024; New Orleans, LA, USA; Washington Huskies wide receiver Rome Odunze (1) warms up before playing against the Texas Longhorns in the 2024 Sugar Bowl college football playoff semifinal game at Caesars Superdome. Mandatory Credit: John David Mercer-USA TODAY Sports
The Bears give Williams some rookie company by selecting wide receiver Rome Odunze with pick number nine. These two offensive superstars can hit the ground running together in the NFL. 

EVANSTON, ILLINOIS – SEPTEMBER 30: Olumuyiwa Fashanu #74 of the Penn State Nittany Lions in action against the Northwestern Wildcats during the second half at Ryan Field on September 30, 2023 in Evanston, Illinois. (Photo by Michael Reaves/Getty Images)
The New York Jets might want to give Aaron Rodgers more protection in 2024. That starts with adding tackle Olu Fashanu out of Penn State. 

Aug 27, 2022; Tallahassee, Florida, USA; Florida State Seminoles defensive end Jared Verse (5) lines up against Duquesne Dukes offensive lineman Chris Oliver (59) during the first half at Doak S. Campbell Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Melina Myers-USA TODAY Sports
The Minnesota Vikings select Florida State defensive end Jared Verse to help them improve their pass rush. 

Sep 9, 2023; San Diego, California, USA; UCLA Bruins defensive lineman Laiatu Latu (15) battles against San Diego State Aztecs tight end Mark Redman (81) during the first half at Snapdragon Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Orlando Ramirez-USA TODAY Sports
Laiatu Latu out of UCLA is someone who will help the Denver Broncos improve their weak pass rush.

Sep 4, 2021; Atlanta, Georgia, USA; Alabama Crimson Tide offensive lineman JC Latham (65) blocks against the Miami Hurricanes at Mercedes-Benz Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Dale Zanine-USA TODAY Sports
The Las Vegas Raiders improve their offensive line with JC Latham at pick 13 out of Alabama. He will be a big help for a new-look Raiders offense. 

Sep 23, 2023; Tuscaloosa, Alabama, USA; Alabama Crimson Tide defensive back Terrion Arnold (3) carries the ball after an interception against the Mississippi Rebels during the second half of a football game at Bryant-Denny Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Butch Dill-USA TODAY Sports
Terrion Arnold out of Alabama will do a great job for the New Orleans Saints in their secondary after being their 14th overall selection. 

Nov 18, 2023; Tallahassee, Florida, USA; Florida State Seminoles wide receiver Keon Coleman (4) catches a ball in the endzone to score a touchdown against the North Alabama Lions during the third quarter at Doak S. Campbell Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Morgan Tencza-USA TODAY Sports
With the 15th overall pick, the Indianapolis Colts select Keon Coleman, which will give Anthony Richardson another good weapon in his second NFL season. 

Michael Wade/Icon Sportswire via Getty Images
The Seattle Seahawks add a good defensive player in cornerback Quinyon Mitchell out of Toledo. 

Nov 25, 2023; Columbia, South Carolina, USA; Clemson Tigers cornerback Nate Wiggins (2) smiles after breaking up a pass to South Carolina wide receiver Nyck Harbor (8) during the fourth quarter at Williams-Brice Stadium. Clemson won 16-7. Mandatory Credit: Ken Ruinard-USA TODAY Sports
The Jacksonville Jaguars add a good cornerback to their defense with Nate Wiggins out of Clemson. They sure do love those Clemson guys in Jacksonville. 

Oct 28, 2023; Lawrence, Kansas, USA; Oklahoma Sooners offensive lineman Tyler Guyton (60) at the line of scrimmage against the Kansas Jayhawks during the game at David Booth Kansas Memorial Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Denny Medley-USA TODAY Sports
The Cincinnati Bengals select Tyler Guyton out of Oklahoma, which will give Joe Burrow an extra layer of protection. 

Oct 21, 2023; Iowa City, Iowa, USA; Iowa Hawkeyes defensive back Cooper DeJean (3) looks on during the game against the Minnesota Golden Gophers at Kinnick Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Jeffrey Becker-USA TODAY Sports
Cooper DeJean out of Iowa will make a great addition to the Los Angeles Rams defense at No. 19.

Dec 31, 2022; New Orleans, LA, USA; Alabama Crimson Tide defensive back Kool-Aid McKinstry (1) reacts after a defensive play against the Kansas State Wildcats during the second half in the 2022 Sugar Bowl at Caesars Superdome. Mandatory Credit: Andrew Wevers-USA TODAY Sports
The Pittsburgh Steelers select Kool-Aid McKinstry out of Alabama to help boost their secondary for the 2024 season and beyond. 

Dec 1, 2023; Las Vegas, NV, USA; Washington Huskies offensive lineman Troy Fautanu (55) celebrates after the Huskies scored against the Oregon Ducks during the first quarter at Allegiant Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Stephen R. Sylvanie-USA TODAY Sports
The Miami Dolphins are happy to be picking in the first round again. Taking Troy Fuatanu out of Washington is a good idea for them as they want to keep the good QB protection going. 

Nov 6, 2021; Minneapolis, Minnesota, USA; Illinois Fighting Illini defensive lineman Jer'Zhan Newton (94) reacts to a missed stop in the third quarter at Huntington Bank Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Matt Krohn-USA TODAY Sports
The Philadelphia Eagles will be looking to bounce back in 2024 and that will feature a new defensive lineman in Jer'Zhan Newton out of Illinois. 

Oct 28, 2023; Tucson, Arizona, USA; Oregon State Beavers offensive lineman Taliese Fuaga #75 walks off the field against the Arizona Wildcats at Arizona Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Zachary BonDurant-USA TODAY Sports
The Houston Texans select Taliese Fuaga out of Oregon State. Falling to him at No. 23 is great news as CJ Stroud now has extra protection going forward. 

Jan 9, 2023; Inglewood, CA, USA; Georgia Bulldogs offensive lineman Amarius Mims (65) against the TCU Horned Frogs during the CFP national championship game at SoFi Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-USA TODAY Sports
The Dallas Cowboys select Amarius Mims out of Georgia at No. 24, who should do a great job protecting his QB Dak Prescott and blocking in the run game. 

Penn State defensive end Chop Robinson (44) celebrates after sacking Massachusetts quarterback Taisun Phommachanh in the first half of a NCAA football game Saturday, Oct. 14, 2023, in State College, Pa. The Nittany Lions won, 63-0.
The Green Bay Packers select Chop Robinson out of Penn State. They don't like selecting offensive skilled position players in the first round, so Robinson is their guy who will drastically improve their pass rush. 

Nov 24, 2023; Eugene, Oregon, USA; Oregon Ducks wide receiver Troy Franklin (11) catches a pass for a touchdown during the first half against the Oregon State Beavers at Autzen Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Troy Wayrynen-USA TODAY Sports
The Tampa Bay Buccaneers decide to draft wide receiver Troy Franklin in the first round. He will try to somewhat replace the production that Mike Evans will leave behind. 

Michigan Wolverines defensive lineman Kris Jenkins (94) celebrates a recovered fumble Saturday, Dec. 2, 2023, during the game at Lucas Oil Stadium in Indianapolis.
The Arizona Cardinals are going to ride with Kyler Murray. They already selected Marvin Harrison Jr. at No. 4, so adding Kris Jenkins will help the other side of the ball. 

Brian Thomas Jr 11 runs the ball as the LSU Tigers take on Texas A&M in Tiger Stadium in Baton Rouge, Louisiana, November 25, 2023.
The Buffalo Bills give Josh Allen another weapon with Brian Thomas Jr. at No. 28. You never know how things go with a few of the guys they already have. Thomas and Josh Allen would be great together. 

Sep 10, 2022; Seattle, Washington, USA; Portland State Vikings quarterback Dante Chachere (15) looks to pass as he is pressured by Washington Huskies defensive lineman Bralen Trice (8) during the first half at Alaska Airlines Field at Husky Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Stephen Brashear-USA TODAY Sports
Both the Detroit Lions and Washington got very far but didn't end with a trophy. As a result, Bralen Trice will be a great match in Detroit coming into 2024. He will make their pass rush even more lethal right away. 

Nov 25, 2023; Tempe, Arizona, USA; Arizona Wildcats offensive lineman Jordan Morgan (77) against the Arizona State Sun Devils during the Territorial Cup at Mountain America Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-USA TODAY Sports
The Baltimore Ravens select Jordan Morgan out of Arizona to help shore up their offensive line. A tackle like that could make a big difference for Lamar Jackson. 

Sep 23, 2023; Athens, Georgia, USA; Georgia Bulldogs defensive back Kamari Lassiter (3) against the UAB Blazers in the second half at Sanford Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Kirby Lee-USA TODAY Sports
The NFC Champion San Francisco 49ers are so close to being at the top of the mountain but they need more help. A good corner like Kamari Lassiter will make their defense better after being the second to last pick of the first round. 

Texas Longhorns wide receiver Adonai Mitchell (5) catches the ball for an first down against Kansas State Wildcats cornerback Jacob Parrish (10) in the. First quarter of an NCAA college football game, Saturday, November. 4, 2023, in Austin, Texas.
The back-to-back Super Bowl champions finally added another good receiver with Adonai Mitchell. The last pick of the first round will give them more weaponry for Patrick Mahomes.

articles.title: 2024 NFL mock draft: First-round projections following the Scouting Combine
articles.author: Vincent Parise
articles.excerpt: In our post-NFL combine mock draft, four quarterbacks go in the first round and the top three receivers go in the first six picks.
articles.summary:
The 2024 NFL Scouting Combine is in the books, and there were plenty of standout performances and players who helped elevate their draft stock ahead of their pro days.
There will be plenty of storylines to follow during the pre-draft process, including the Chicago Bears leading things off with the No. 1 overall pick (and a franchise-altering quarterback decision yet to be made).
In fact, the quarterbacks will be a storyline that dominates night one of the draft next month. While Caleb Williams, Drake Maye and Jayden Daniels are expected to go 1-2-3, JJ McCarthy and Bo Nix could also be in the mix to go in the first round.
Wide receiver is also worth monitoring, as we could see three of the draft's top options in Marvin Harrison Jr., Rome Odunze and Malik Nabers go in the top-10.
The NFL combine gave teams a chance to see these players up close and formally meet with them. None of the things done at the combine can outweigh things that are done on a football field in games that count, but they could account for tiebreakers if teams are town between a few players. 
With the NFL combine in the books, here's our updated first-round projections featuring some standouts:

LOS ANGELES, CALIFORNIA – NOVEMBER 18: Caleb Williams #13 of the USC Trojans passes the ball during the first half of a game against the UCLA Bruins at United Airlines Field at the Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum on November 18, 2023 in Los Angeles, California. (Photo by Sean M. Haffey/Getty Images)
Nothing has changed here. The Chicago Bears take Caleb Williams with the number one overall pick in the draft. 

Nov 25, 2023; Raleigh, North Carolina, USA; North Carolina Tar Heels quarterback Drake Maye (10) throws a pass against the North Carolina State Wolfpack during the first half at Carter-Finley Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Rob Kinnan-USA TODAY Sports
Not much has changed here either as a result of the combine. The Washington Commanders select Drake Maye with the second overall pick. 

Nov 18, 2023; Baton Rouge, Louisiana, USA; Heisman Trophy candidate LSU Tigers quarterback Jayden Daniels (5) warms up before their game against the Georgia State Panthers at Tiger Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Matthew Dobbins-USA TODAY Sports
The New England Patriots are about to start a brand new era with a brand new QB after selecting Jayden Daniels out of LSU with the third overall pick. 

Sep 23, 2023; South Bend, Indiana, USA; Ohio State Buckeyes wide receiver Marvin Harrison Jr. (18) tries to come up with the catch against Notre Dame Fighting Irish cornerback Benjamin Morrison (20) but draws a penalty during the second quarter of their game at Notre Dame Stadium.
The combine can't undo what we've seen from Marvin Harrison Jr. for the last few years at Ohio State. The Arizona Cardinals give Kyler Murray a number one receiver by selecting him with the number four pick. 

Nov 11, 2023; Seattle, Washington, USA; Washington Huskies wide receiver Rome Odunze (1) celebrates scoring a touchdown against the Utah Utes during the second half at Alaska Airlines Field at Husky Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Steven Bisig-USA TODAY Sports
Rome Odunze impressed a lot of people at the 2024 Scouting Combine. The Los Angeles Chargers draft him fifth overall to give Justin Herbert another weapon.

Malik Nabers 8 as the LSU Tigers take on Texas A&M in Tiger Stadium in Baton Rouge, Louisiana, November 25, 2023.
With two of the big three WRs off the board, the New York Giants can't let the third slip past them. They select Malik Nabers with the sixth overall pick in the draft. 

Sep 9, 2023; Raleigh, North Carolina, USA; Notre Dame Fighting Irish tackle Joe Alt (76) during the first half at Carter-Finley Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Rob Kinnan-USA TODAY Sports
The Tennessee Titans don't mess around with offensive linemen. They will do great things with Joe Alt, who's selected seventh overall. 

Dec 2, 2023; Atlanta, GA, USA; Alabama Crimson Tide linebacker Dallas Turner (15) celebrates after a sack in the second quarter against the Georgia Bulldogs in the SEC Championship at Mercedes-Benz Stadium. Mandatory Credit: John David Mercer-USA TODAY Sports
You know Alabama pumps out elite defensive prospects with regularity. The Atlanta Falcons get the next great one with Dallas Turner at eighth overall. 

Sep 9, 2023; San Diego, California, USA; UCLA Bruins defensive lineman Laiatu Latu (15) battles against San Diego State Aztecs tight end Mark Redman (81) during the first half at Snapdragon Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Orlando Ramirez-USA TODAY Sports
The Chicago Bears improve their edge rushing by adding Laiatu Latu with the ninth overall pick. Pairing him with Montez Sweat will make them very dangerous in the pass rush. 

Georgia tight end Brock Bowers (19) scores a touchdown during the second half of a NCAA college football game against Ole Miss in Athens, Ga., on Saturday, Nov. 11, 2023. Georgia won 52-17.
The New York Jets take advantage of Brock Bowers falling a few spots. The Falcons and Bears have good tight ends, which leaves him for the Jets at 10. 

EVANSTON, ILLINOIS – SEPTEMBER 30: Olumuyiwa Fashanu #74 of the Penn State Nittany Lions in action against the Northwestern Wildcats during the second half at Ryan Field on September 30, 2023 in Evanston, Illinois. (Photo by Michael Reaves/Getty Images)
The Minnesota Vikings bring Kirk Cousins back, so they give him a little bit more protection with Olu Fashanu at 11th overall. 

Oct 28, 2023; Tucson, Arizona, USA; Oregon State Beavers offensive lineman Taliese Fuaga #75 walks off the field against the Arizona Wildcats at Arizona Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Zachary BonDurant-USA TODAY Sports
The Denver Broncos are going to have a new quarterback in 2024, but we don't know who it is going to be. However, Taliese Fuaga will do a good job helping protect him after being the 12th overall pick. 

Nov 25, 2023; Columbia, South Carolina, USA; Clemson Tigers cornerback Nate Wiggins (2) smiles after breaking up a pass to South Carolina wide receiver Nyck Harbor (8) during the fourth quarter at Williams-Brice Stadium. Clemson won 16-7. Mandatory Credit: Ken Ruinard-USA TODAY Sports
Nate Wiggins out of Clemson had the second-fastest 40-yard dash time of any player at the combine. The Las Vegas Raiders will love having him with the 13th overall pick in the draft. 

Florida State defensive lineman Jared Verse speaks during a news conference at the NFL football scouting combine, Wednesday, Feb. 28, 2024, in Indianapolis. (AP Photo/Darron Cummings) ORG XMIT: INDC105
The New Orleans Saints bolster their pass rush by selecting Jared Verse with the 14th overall pick in the draft. 

Sep 23, 2023; Tuscaloosa, Alabama, USA; Alabama Crimson Tide defensive back Terrion Arnold (3) carries the ball after an interception against the Mississippi Rebels during the second half of a football game at Bryant-Denny Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Butch Dill-USA TODAY Sports
With the 15th overall pick, the Indianapolis Colts select Terrion Arnold out of Alabama. He will help them in their secondary. 

Michael Wade/Icon Sportswire via Getty Images
With the third-highest 40-yard dash score at the combine, Quinyon Mitchell has helped raise his draft stock. Being a player out of Toledo, he will make the MAC proud as the 16th overall pick made by the Seattle Seahawks. 

Sep 4, 2021; Atlanta, Georgia, USA; Alabama Crimson Tide offensive lineman JC Latham (65) blocks against the Miami Hurricanes at Mercedes-Benz Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Dale Zanine-USA TODAY Sports
Alabama pumps out good offensive linemen regularly, as well. The Jacksonville Jaguars could use help there so they take JC Latham with the 17th overall pick. 

Jan 9, 2023; Inglewood, CA, USA; Georgia Bulldogs offensive lineman Amarius Mims (65) against the TCU Horned Frogs during the CFP national championship game at SoFi Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-USA TODAY Sports
The Cincinnati Bengals continue to stress protecting Joe Burrow by selecting Amarius Mims with the 18th overall selection. 

Oct 21, 2023; Iowa City, Iowa, USA; Iowa Hawkeyes defensive back Cooper DeJean (3) looks on during the game against the Minnesota Golden Gophers at Kinnick Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Jeffrey Becker-USA TODAY Sports
The Los Angeles Rams take the Iowa kid Cooper DeJean with the 19th overall pick and he will help them in their secondary. 

Dec 31, 2022; New Orleans, LA, USA; Alabama Crimson Tide defensive back Kool-Aid McKinstry (1) reacts after a defensive play against the Kansas State Wildcats during the second half in the 2022 Sugar Bowl at Caesars Superdome. Mandatory Credit: Andrew Wevers-USA TODAY Sports
Although the Pittsburgh Steelers could use some help on their offense, they continue to build their defense by adding Kool-Aid McKinstry with the 20th overall selection. 

Mar 2, 2024; Indianapolis, IN, USA; Oregon offensive lineman Jackson Powers-Johnson (OL58) talks to the media during the 2024 NFL Combine at Lucas Oil Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Trevor Ruszkowski-USA TODAY Sports
Jackson Powers-Johnson is considered the top center prospect, and the Miami Dolphins move on from free agent Connor Williams when they take Powers-Johnson 21st overall. 

Dec 1, 2023; Las Vegas, NV, USA; Washington Huskies offensive lineman Troy Fautanu (55) celebrates after the Huskies scored against the Oregon Ducks during the first quarter at Allegiant Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Stephen R. Sylvanie-USA TODAY Sports
Jason Kelce made his retirement official on Monday afternoon. The rest of their offensive line isn't necessarily young either. They start to rebuild it by selecting Troy Fuatanu out of Washington with the 22nd overall pick. 

Nov 18, 2023; Ames, Iowa, USA; Texas Longhorns defensive lineman Byron Murphy II (90) celebrates sacking the Iowa State Cyclones quarterback during the game at Jack Trice Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Aaron E. Martinez-USA TODAY Sports
With Will Anderson Jr. helping the Houston Texans defense take a big step last season, adding a stud like Byron Murphy II with the 23rd overall pick is very smart. 

Penn State defensive end Chop Robinson (44) celebrates after sacking Massachusetts quarterback Taisun Phommachanh in the first half of a NCAA football game Saturday, Oct. 14, 2023, in State College, Pa. The Nittany Lions won, 63-0.
Chop Robinson out of Penn State had a good combine. He might go even earlier than expected in the draft. The Dallas Cowboys would be happy to land him with the 24th overall pick. 

Brian Thomas Jr 11 runs the ball as the LSU Tigers take on Texas A&M in Tiger Stadium in Baton Rouge, Louisiana, November 25, 2023.
Malik Nabers isn't the only good LSU wide receiver in this draft. The Green Bay Packers select Brian Thomas Jr. to help Jordan Love take a step in 2024. Green Bay ends its long streak of no first-round skill position players on offense (non-QB). 

Michigan quarterback J.J. McCarthy warms up before the national championship game at NRG Stadium in Houston on Monday, Jan. 8, 2024.
The Tampa Bay Buccaneers know what it is like to have an underrated (during college) Michigan alum lead them to glory. They don't waste another opportunity to do it as they shock the world by selecting J.J. McCarthy with the 26th overall pick. 

Nov 11, 2023; Chapel Hill, North Carolina, USA; Duke Blue Devils offensive lineman Graham Barton (62) before the game at Kenan Memorial Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Bob Donnan-USA TODAY Sports
The Arizona Cardinals, who already drafted an elite WR in this mock, bolster up their offensive line by taking Duke's Graham Barton. 

Oct 28, 2023; Lawrence, Kansas, USA; Oklahoma Sooners offensive lineman Tyler Guyton (60) at the line of scrimmage against the Kansas Jayhawks during the game at David Booth Kansas Memorial Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Denny Medley-USA TODAY Sports
The Buffalo Bills add to their offensive line by selecting Tyler Guyton out of Oklahoma. This is a good move following their decision to trade away Ryan Bates. 

Nov 6, 2021; Minneapolis, Minnesota, USA; Illinois Fighting Illini defensive lineman Jer'Zhan Newton (94) reacts to a missed stop in the third quarter at Huntington Bank Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Matt Krohn-USA TODAY Sports
From Illinois to Michigan, the Detroit Lions select Jer'Zhan Newton to help them improve their pass rush/run defense. Drafting in the late stages of the first round is new territory for the defending NFC runner ups so they need to learn how to draft well at this stage of the event. 

Nov 18, 2023; Tallahassee, Florida, USA; Florida State Seminoles wide receiver Keon Coleman (4) catches a ball in the endzone to score a touchdown against the North Alabama Lions during the third quarter at Doak S. Campbell Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Morgan Tencza-USA TODAY Sports
The Baltimore Ravens are one of the best teams in the NFL but they can't get over one AFC rival. They are hoping that another weapon for Lamar Jackson can help them improve their chances so they draft Keon Coleman with the 30th overall pick. 

Nov 25, 2023; Tempe, Arizona, USA; Arizona Wildcats offensive lineman Jordan Morgan (77) against the Arizona State Sun Devils during the Territorial Cup at Mountain America Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-USA TODAY Sports
The San Francisco 49ers are as close to a perfect team as you can be in the NFL. That hasn't allowed them to beat Patrick Mahomes in the big game though. Adding a stud offensive lineman like Jordan Morgan out of Arizona will certainly help them along though. 

Sep 10, 2022; Austin, Texas, USA; Texas Longhorns wide receiver Xavier Worthy (8) catches a pass and lands out of bounds in the end zone against the Alabama Crimson Tide during the first half at Darrell K Royal-Texas Memorial Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Scott Wachter-USA TODAY Sports
When you're the defending Super Bowl champions, you can take a risk or two in the upcoming draft. That is especially true when you need a good wide receiver more than anything. With the 32nd overall pick, the Kansas City Chiefs select Xavier Worthy out of Texas. His stock improved at the combine when he set the record for the fastest 40-yard dash time in the history of the event. Imagine Patrick Mahomes getting another guy with similar speed to Tyreek Hill.

articles.title: Takeaways from Wisconsin's blowout loss to Rutgers
articles.author: Ben Kenney
articles.excerpt: Thoughts on the loss to Rutgers?
articles.summary:
Wisconsin basketball lost in blowout fashion at the hands of the Rutgers Scarlet Knights yesterday afternoon.
The loss is the Badgers' fourth straight and drops them to 16-8 on the season and 8-5 in Big Ten play.
Related: 
This may sound like a broken record, but Wisconsin entered the month of February ranked No. 6 in the nation and in first place in the Big Ten with a 16-4 (8-1 Big Ten) record.
Not only is the team now 16-8 (8-5 Big Ten), but it is a full three games behind first-place Purdue, down to No. 18 in KenPom and set to continue its slide in the AP Poll.
Things are not right at the moment and yesterday's performance at Rutgers seemed to accentuate all of the team's issues. Here are takeaways from the blowout loss:
Feb 10, 2024; Piscataway, New Jersey, USA; Rutgers Scarlet Knights guard Noah Fernandes (2) shoots the ball against Wisconsin Badgers guard Max Klesmit (11) and forward Nolan Winter (31) during the second half at Jersey Mike's Arena. Mandatory Credit: Vincent Carchietta-USA TODAY Sports
I was in the building yesterday. It felt like every single Rutgers shot attempt in the second half went in, especially from beyond the arc.
The Scarlet Knights as a team shot 44.8% from the field, but 58.8% from three — led by guard Noah Fernandes who scored 17 points on 6/6 shooting and 5/5 from beyond the arc. He couldn't miss.
Evan Flood put some context to the Rutgers hot streak. The team entered as one of the nation's worst shooting teams.
 
Just nothing will go right now, lol.
Rutgers is No. 350 in the country in 3-point shooting and now they've made 10 3-pointers.#Badgers
— Evan Flood (@Evan_Flood) February 10, 2024

Rutgers is BOTTOM 15 NATIONALLY in 3pt%.. 352nd in the country!!
They're 9 for 16 today.. 56.3%
— ᗩᑎT ᗯᖇIGᕼT (@itsAntWright) February 10, 2024

As many people say, that's just basketball.
 
Feb 10, 2024; Piscataway, New Jersey, USA; Wisconsin Badgers head coach Greg Gard reacts during the second half against the Rutgers Scarlet Knights at Jersey Mike's Arena. Mandatory Credit: Vincent Carchietta-USA TODAY Sports
The most alarming part of the performance began at the opening tip. Rutgers brought full-court pressure immediately, and Wisconsin quickly became unable to advance the ball up the court.
Has Wisconsin ever seen a press before?
— Ben Kenney (@benzkenney) February 10, 2024

Now, hyperbolizing on ‘X' in this manner has many pointing out that the team obviously practices beating a press. I don't doubt that fact at all.
But that's how bad it looked at times on Saturday with sloppy dribbling, ill-advised passes, back-court violations and more. It looked like Rutgers found some schematic approach that Wisconsin didn't know how to defeat.
Feb 10, 2024; Piscataway, New Jersey, USA; Rutgers Scarlet Knights center Clifford Omoruyi (11) dunks the ball against Wisconsin Badgers forward Steven Crowl (22) and forward Tyler Wahl (5) during the second half at Jersey Mike's Arena. Mandatory Credit: Vincent Carchietta-USA TODAY Sports
This is the part of the matchup we should've seen coming.
Jersey Mike's Arena is a notoriously challenging place to play. Although this Rutgers team isn't that good, it is 10-3 at home and only 3-5 on the road. Being in attendance yesterday I could see why.
The atmosphere was electric for it being an early afternoon game. The Scarlet Knights clearly fed off that energy — something the Badgers were never able to match.
 
Feb 10, 2024; Piscataway, New Jersey, USA; Wisconsin Badgers head coach Greg Gard bumps fists with forward Tyler Wahl (5) during the first half against the Rutgers Scarlet Knights at Jersey Mike's Arena. Mandatory Credit: Vincent Carchietta-USA TODAY Sports
There can't be much second-guessing of the head coach when the opponent shoots nearly 60% from three and runs away with a decisive victory. Much of that was Rutgers came to play yesterday, and Wisconsin didn't
But there is one decision by Gard I'd second-guess: immediately benching Max Klesmit after he picked up his second foul with 13:31 left in the first half.
I understand the approach, that Klesmit is more valuable on the court in crunch time than he would be if he fouled out.
But this thinking forgets the context of the situation: Wisconsin backup point guard Kamari McGee remains out with an injury, as does impressive freshman guard John Blackwell. So the Badgers' guard rotation is shallow, as Gard was forced to go to Connor Essegian for 24 minutes and Isaac Lindsey for eight.
This means not only is Klesmit's ball-handling ability and veteran presence on the bench, but also the usual replacements aren't available. That discrepancy was seen as Wisconsin tried to break Rutgers' pressure, generate consistent offense and take the energy out of a hectic arena.
Plus, this thinking assumes Wisconsin would even get to crunch time still in arm's distance. Instead, the Badgers trailed by 15-20 for the entire second half and never put a run together. Earlier first-half minutes for Klesmit may have evened the playing field at least a bit.
MADISON, WISCONSIN – MARCH 14: Connor Essegian #3 of the Wisconsin Badgers reacts after a made three point shot by Steven Crowl during the first half of the game at Kohl Center on March 14, 2023 in Madison, Wisconsin. (Photo by John Fisher/Getty Images)
In what has been a rocky sophomore season for Connor Essegian, he was a clear bright spot during yesterday's loss.
The young guard played 24 minutes off the bench and led the team with 15 points.
With Chucky Hepburn unable to find his shot, Tyler Wahl and Steven Crowl struggling to score on the inside and A.J. Storr's poor shooting, Essegian's scoring spark was the only thing keeping the Badgers competitive early in the second half.
Mar 28, 2023; Las Vegas, NV, USA; Wisconsin Badgers guard Chucky Hepburn (23) passes the ball against the North Texas Mean Green in the first half at Orleans Arena. Mandatory Credit: Candice Ward-USA TODAY Sports
I wrote this after Wisconsin's tight loss to Purdue last Sunday, and it still applies:
Chucky Hepburn has been a valuable part of the Badgers' team all season, even though he averages just over seven points per game.
On Sunday he finished with six points — all in garbage time.
These are the games Hepburn needs to match the opposing point guard and contribute offensively. On Sunday, there seemed to be way too much passivity as opportunities for shots were passed up.
It's fine to say that Hepburn needs to do more on offense.
This was the case yet again at Rutgers. Midway through the second half as the Badgers trailed by 15 points and were barely in the game, Hepburn had attempted only one shot.
I'm no advocate of forcing bad shots or straying from the normal offense. But the Badgers weren't getting good looks all afternoon, and it felt like a situation where a veteran point guard should take over and at least generate some offense.
Wisconsin's losing skid can't be righted until the point guard returns to scoring the basketball.
Feb 10, 2024; Piscataway, New Jersey, USA; Wisconsin Badgers guard Max Klesmit (11) shoots the ball against Rutgers Scarlet Knights center Clifford Omoruyi (11) during the second half at Jersey Mike's Arena. Mandatory Credit: Vincent Carchietta-USA TODAY Sports
After the loss to Purdue, many looked ahead to games against last-place Michigan and 12-10 Rutgers as get-right opportunities for this Wisconsin team.
Well, here we are and the Badgers lost both. Given the state of their play and last week of results, the team could lose to anybody and it wouldn't be a surprise.
Coming up are winnable games vs Ohio State, at Iowa, vs Maryland and at Indiana. Now, those games seem just as losable as they are winnable.
After that is a mini-gauntlet to close the season. Home against No. 10 Illinois, home against Rutgers and at No. 2 Purdue.
This four-game skid must be snapped immediately. But the Badgers then still must quickly improve to avoid this promising season slipping away.

articles.title: 2024 NFL mock draft: The offense is dominating ahead of the combine
articles.author: Vincent Parise
articles.excerpt: The NFL Scouting Combine kicks off this week. Here's a look at our latest first-round projections, where a QB falls outside the top 10.
articles.summary:
The 2024 NFL Scouting Combine is getting underway in Indianapolis, where general managers, coaches and staff will get a chance to see some of the NFL draft's top prospects in action and inside the meeting room.
Ryan Poles and the Chicago Bears are on the clock. For the second year in a row, Chicago has the first overall pick, courtesy of the Carolina Panthers in a trade of the top selection last year (where they also got DJ Moore, Darnell Wright, Tyrique Stevenson and a 2025 second rounder). The Panthers selected Alabama quarterback Bryce Young.
Although hindsight tells us that this is one of the greatest trades in NFL history, Poles' tenure as Bears GM rides on making the right decision this year. Will he trade the top pick in favor of keeping Justin Fields or stay put and select a rookie, most likely Caleb Williams?
That's the top storyline heading into the combine, where Poles' phone has already been ringing off the hook as teams try to gauge the temperature of which direction Chicago is leaning. There has been interest both in trading for the No. 1 pick and trading for Fields, so the Bears are worth monitoring this week as things could happen quickly on the Fields front.
That is the top story and it will lead off a wonderful first round. But all 32 teams are going to try and get better this offseason, and the combine will serve as a big opportunity for them to get to know these prospects with the draft just a couple of months out. 
So before the combine action kicks off with on-field workouts on Thursday, here are first-round projections in our latest mock draft:

Oct 7, 2023; Los Angeles, California, USA; Southern California Trojans quarterback Caleb Williams (13) throws against the Arizona Wildcats during the first half at Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum. Mandatory Credit: Gary A. Vasquez-USA TODAY Sports
With the first overall pick in the draft, the Chicago Bears make a huge decision and take USC star quarterback Caleb Williams. In the process, they trade Justin Fields to the Atlanta Falcons. 

Nov 25, 2023; Raleigh, North Carolina, USA; North Carolina Tar Heels quarterback Drake Maye (10) throws a pass against the North Carolina State Wolfpack during the first half at Carter-Finley Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Rob Kinnan-USA TODAY Sports
With Caleb Williams off the board, the Washington Commanders take Drake Maye out of North Carolina. They are hoping that he helps them turn their franchise around. 

Oct 7, 2023; Ohio Stadium, Ohio, USA;
Ohio State Buckeyes wide receiver Marvin Harrison Jr. (18) catches the ball during their game against the Maryland Terrapins on Saturday, Oct. 7, 2023.
The new-look New England Patriots pass on drafting a first-round QB to take Marvin Harrison Jr. with the third overall pick. Then, they look to free agency to find someone to throw him the ball. Russell Wilson makes a lot of sense there. 

Georgia tight end Brock Bowers (19) scores a touchdown during the second half of a NCAA college football game against Ole Miss in Athens, Ga., on Saturday, Nov. 11, 2023. Georgia won 52-17.
After committing to Kyler Murray in the long term, the Arizona Cardinals give him a star tight end by drafting Brock Bowers with the fourth overall pick. 

Malik Nabers 8 as the LSU Tigers take on Texas A&M in Tiger Stadium in Baton Rouge, Louisiana, November 25, 2023.
Jim Harbaugh is ready to make an impact on the NFL again after winning the National Championship with Michigan. They start by drafting a star wideout in Malik Nabers for Justin Herbert to throw to. 

Dec 2, 2023; Atlanta, GA, USA; Alabama Crimson Tide linebacker Dallas Turner (15) celebrates after a sack in the second quarter against the Georgia Bulldogs in the SEC Championship at Mercedes-Benz Stadium. Mandatory Credit: John David Mercer-USA TODAY Sports
The New York Football Giants select Dallas Turner with the sixth overall pick. He will help them be better at getting to the opposing QB. 

Sep 9, 2023; Seattle, Washington, USA; Washington Huskies wide receiver Rome Odunze (1) runs for yards after the catch against the Tulsa Golden Hurricane during the third quarter at Alaska Airlines Field at Husky Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Joe Nicholson-USA TODAY Sports
The Tennessee Titans finally will have a star wide receiver that they drafted and developed once again when they take Rome Odunze with the seventh overall pick. 

Sep 9, 2023; Raleigh, North Carolina, USA; Notre Dame Fighting Irish tackle Joe Alt (76) during the first half at Carter-Finley Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Rob Kinnan-USA TODAY Sports
Now that the Atlanta Falcons have Justin Fields in this mock, they draft Joe Alt out of Notre Dame to help keep him protected. 

Aug 27, 2022; Tallahassee, Florida, USA; Florida State Seminoles defensive end Jared Verse (5) lines up against Duquesne Dukes offensive lineman Chris Oliver (59) during the first half at Doak S. Campbell Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Melina Myers-USA TODAY Sports
Outside of quarterback, which they addressed with the first overall pick, the Chicago Bears need some help on the pass rush. They will pair Montez Sweat with Jared Verse after selecting him with the ninth overall pick. 

EVANSTON, ILLINOIS – SEPTEMBER 30: Olumuyiwa Fashanu #74 of the Penn State Nittany Lions in action against the Northwestern Wildcats during the second half at Ryan Field on September 30, 2023 in Evanston, Illinois. (Photo by Michael Reaves/Getty Images)
Aaron Rodgers hurt himself on the fourth play of the 2023 season after all of the hype. The New York Jets will try to do a better job of protecting him and it starts with taking Olu Fashanu with the 10th overall pick. 

Sep 9, 2023; San Diego, California, USA; UCLA Bruins defensive lineman Laiatu Latu (15) battles against San Diego State Aztecs tight end Mark Redman (81) during the first half at Snapdragon Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Orlando Ramirez-USA TODAY Sports
The Minnesota Vikings will retain Kirk Cousins which means that their offense will be great around him. That is why they went defense with pick 11 by selecting Laiatu Latu out of UCLA. 

Nov 18, 2023; Baton Rouge, Louisiana, USA; Heisman Trophy candidate LSU Tigers quarterback Jayden Daniels (5) warms up before their game against the Georgia State Panthers at Tiger Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Matthew Dobbins-USA TODAY Sports
Assuming the Denver Broncos part ways with Russell Wilson, they need a new quarterback. They take advantage of Jayden Daniels falling and select him with the 12th overall pick. 

Sep 23, 2023; Tuscaloosa, Alabama, USA; Alabama Crimson Tide defensive back Terrion Arnold (3) carries the ball after an interception against the Mississippi Rebels during the second half of a football game at Bryant-Denny Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Butch Dill-USA TODAY Sports
The Las Vegas Raiders select Terrion Arnold out of Alabama with the 13th overall pick. This makes their secondary better right away. 

Sep 4, 2021; Atlanta, Georgia, USA; Alabama Crimson Tide offensive lineman JC Latham (65) blocks against the Miami Hurricanes at Mercedes-Benz Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Dale Zanine-USA TODAY Sports
The New Orleans Saints are always looking to become a better team. Drafting Alabama lineman JC Latham with the 14th overall pick is their play here. 

Nov 18, 2023; Tallahassee, Florida, USA; Florida State Seminoles wide receiver Keon Coleman (4) celebrates a touchdown against the North Alabama Lions during the third quarter at Doak S. Campbell Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Morgan Tencza-USA TODAY Sports
The Indianapolis Colts would love to get Anthony Richardson another weapon. Keon Coleman out of Florida State is a great option for them with pick 15. 

Michael Wade/Icon Sportswire via Getty Images
With the 16th overall pick, the Seattle Seahawks select Quinyon Mitchell out of Toledo hoping he becomes the next great Seahawks defensive back. 

Oct 28, 2023; Lawrence, Kansas, USA; Oklahoma Sooners offensive lineman Tyler Guyton (60) at the line of scrimmage against the Kansas Jayhawks during the game at David Booth Kansas Memorial Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Denny Medley-USA TODAY Sports
After a disappointing end to the season that started so promising, the Jacksonville Jaguars add to the protection of Trevor Lawrence by taking Tyler Guyton out of Oklahoma. 

Nov 25, 2023; Columbia, South Carolina, USA; Clemson Tigers cornerback Nate Wiggins (2) smiles after breaking up a pass to South Carolina wide receiver Nyck Harbor (8) during the fourth quarter at Williams-Brice Stadium. Clemson won 16-7. Mandatory Credit: Ken Ruinard-USA TODAY Sports
Nate Wiggins out of Clemson is the pick for the Cincinnati Bengals with pick 18. If Joe Burrow is healthy with a defense like that, they could get back to the playoffs with ease. 

Oct 21, 2023; Iowa City, Iowa, USA; Iowa Hawkeyes defensive back Cooper DeJean (3) looks on during the game against the Minnesota Golden Gophers at Kinnick Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Jeffrey Becker-USA TODAY Sports
The Los Angeles Rams are loaded on offense when everybody is healthy. Adding Iowa's Cooper DeJean with pick 19 will help their defense. 

Dec 31, 2022; New Orleans, LA, USA; Alabama Crimson Tide defensive back Kool-Aid McKinstry (1) reacts after a defensive play against the Kansas State Wildcats during the second half in the 2022 Sugar Bowl at Caesars Superdome. Mandatory Credit: Andrew Wevers-USA TODAY Sports
The Pittsburgh Steelers go defense with pick 20 as they select Kool-Aid McKinstry out of Alabama to help them in their secondary. 

Nov 6, 2021; Minneapolis, Minnesota, USA; Illinois Fighting Illini defensive lineman Jer'Zhan Newton (94) reacts to a missed stop in the third quarter at Huntington Bank Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Matt Krohn-USA TODAY Sports
The Miami Dolphins had a historic offense at times in 2023 but they didn't defend well enough. Adding a DL like Jer'Zhan Newton out of Illinois may help with that issue. 

Dec 1, 2023; Las Vegas, NV, USA; Washington Huskies offensive lineman Troy Fautanu (55) celebrates after the Huskies scored against the Oregon Ducks during the first quarter at Allegiant Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Stephen R. Sylvanie-USA TODAY Sports
The Philadelphia Eagles lost Jason Kelce to retirement and a lot of their other all-time great offensive lineman are getting old. Drafting a good one like Troy Fuatanu out of Washington is a great idea with pick 22. 

Oct 28, 2023; Tucson, Arizona, USA; Oregon State Beavers offensive lineman Taliese Fuaga #75 walks off the field against the Arizona Wildcats at Arizona Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Zachary BonDurant-USA TODAY Sports
The Houston Texans have been very good at drafting lately. With pick 23 in 2024, they add another great player in Oregon State's Taliese Fuaga. 

Jan 9, 2023; Inglewood, CA, USA; Georgia Bulldogs offensive lineman Amarius Mims (65) against the TCU Horned Frogs during the CFP national championship game at SoFi Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-USA TODAY Sports
The Dallas Cowboys are known for building a good offensive line. They add to it by selecting Georgia OL Amarius Mims with pick number 24. 

Nov 24, 2023; Eugene, Oregon, USA; Oregon Ducks wide receiver Troy Franklin (11) catches a pass for a touchdown during the first half against the Oregon State Beavers at Autzen Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Troy Wayrynen-USA TODAY Sports
Jordan Love could use a few more weapons going forward. That is why the Green Bay Packers select Troy Franklin out of Oregon. He will help Love continue to take steps. 

Penn State defensive end Chop Robinson (44) celebrates after sacking Massachusetts quarterback Taisun Phommachanh in the first half of a NCAA football game Saturday, Oct. 14, 2023, in State College, Pa. The Nittany Lions won, 63-0.
The Tampa Bay Buccaneers will keep Baker Mayfield so they turned to their defense in the first round. That led them to draft Chop Robinson out of Penn State. He will help them get to the quarterback. 

Brian Thomas Jr 11 runs the ball as the LSU Tigers take on Texas A&M in Tiger Stadium in Baton Rouge, Louisiana, November 25, 2023.
The Arizona Cardinals gave Kyler Murray a tight end in Brock Bowers earlier in this mock draft. Here, they add him a wide receiver in Brian Thomas Jr. 

Michigan Wolverines defensive lineman Kris Jenkins (94) celebrates a recovered fumble Saturday, Dec. 2, 2023, during the game at Lucas Oil Stadium in Indianapolis.
Adding a good defensive lineman may be a good idea for the Buffalo Bills. With pick 28, they select Kris Jenkins who just might help them get to the opposing QB right away. 

Texas Longhorns wide receiver Adonai Mitchell (5) catches the ball for an first down against Kansas State Wildcats cornerback Jacob Parrish (10) in the. First quarter of an NCAA college football game, Saturday, November. 4, 2023, in Austin, Texas.
The Detroit Lions were so close in 2023-24. Adding a wide receiver in Adonai Mitchell out of Texas may be a way for them to get over the hump so they can close out big games. 

Sep 23, 2023; Athens, Georgia, USA; Georgia Bulldogs defensive back Kamari Lassiter (3) against the UAB Blazers in the second half at Sanford Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Kirby Lee-USA TODAY Sports
The Baltimore Ravens are close to being a perfect team that just can't beat the Kansas City Chiefs. With that, they take Georgia DB Kamari Lassiter with the 29th pick to try and get over the hump. 

Nov 25, 2023; Tempe, Arizona, USA; Arizona Wildcats offensive lineman Jordan Morgan (77) against the Arizona State Sun Devils during the Territorial Cup at Mountain America Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-USA TODAY Sports
Like the Ravens, the San Francisco 49ers are very close to having a perfect roster. They are even closer because they don't pay their QB much. In the draft, taking a chance on a good offensive tackle might be the best route for them to take so they go with Jordan Morgan out of Arizona. 

Sep 10, 2022; Seattle, Washington, USA; Portland State Vikings quarterback Dante Chachere (15) looks to pass as he is pressured by Washington Huskies defensive lineman Bralen Trice (8) during the first half at Alaska Airlines Field at Husky Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Stephen Brashear-USA TODAY Sports
What do the defending Super Bowl champions need? They have everything they need, right? Wrong. They might need some help with the pass rush if Chris Jones leaves this offseason. Their backup plan is to select Bralen Trice out of Washington with the final pick of the first round.

articles.title: 2024 NFL mock draft: First-round projections following Keenan Allen trade
articles.author: Vincent Parise
articles.excerpt: The Bears made a splash trading for WR Keenan Allen. Here's our updated NFL mock draft following that move and free agency.
articles.summary:
The Chicago Bears and Los Angeles Chargers made a huge trade on Thursday night. Keenan Allen, who has spent 11 wonderful seasons with the Chargers organization, is now a member of the Bears. 
With the number one overall pick that they have from the Carolina Panthers, Chicago is expected to draft their next franchise quarterback. They also have their own pick at number nine. 
The Los Angeles Chargers also hold the 5th overall pick and their plans could be completely different. Will they now take a wide receiver? 
A whole lot of teams' plans may be impacted by this trade. This is what the first round might look like knowing that the Keenan Allen trade went down: 

LOS ANGELES, CALIFORNIA – NOVEMBER 18: Caleb Williams #13 of the USC Trojans passes the ball during the first half of a game against the UCLA Bruins at United Airlines Field at the Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum on November 18, 2023 in Los Angeles, California. (Photo by Sean M. Haffey/Getty Images)
There are very few things that could realistically happen that could keep the Chicago Bears from drafting Caleb Williams with the number one overall pick. 

Nov 25, 2023; Raleigh, North Carolina, USA; North Carolina Tar Heels quarterback Drake Maye (10) throws a pass against the North Carolina State Wolfpack during the first half at Carter-Finley Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Rob Kinnan-USA TODAY Sports
The Washington Commanders are going to take Drake Maye with the number two overall pick in the draft. They need a new man under center after clearing house at quarterback. 

Nov 18, 2023; Baton Rouge, Louisiana, USA; Heisman Trophy candidate LSU Tigers quarterback Jayden Daniels (5) warms up before their game against the Georgia State Panthers at Tiger Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Matthew Dobbins-USA TODAY Sports
It is time for a new era for the New England Patriots. They select Jayden Daniels out of LSU with the third overall pick. 

Sep 23, 2023; South Bend, Indiana, USA; Ohio State Buckeyes wide receiver Marvin Harrison Jr. (18) tries to come up with the catch against Notre Dame Fighting Irish cornerback Benjamin Morrison (20) but draws a penalty during the second quarter of their game at Notre Dame Stadium.
The first non-QB off the board is going to be Ohio State star Marvin Harrison Jr. He will be an impactful wide receiver right away. 

Malik Nabers 8 as the LSU Tigers take on Texas A&M in Tiger Stadium in Baton Rouge, Louisiana, November 25, 2023.
The Los Angeles Chargers are going to select a receiver after trading Keenan Allen to the Bears. They select LSU's Malik Nabers at No. 5.

Jan 1, 2022; Glendale, Arizona, USA; Notre Dame Fighting Irish offensive lineman Joe Alt (76) against the Oklahoma State Cowboys in the 2022 Fiesta Bowl at State Farm Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-USA TODAY Sports
The New York Giants boost their offensive line by drafting Joe Alt with the sixth overall pick in the draft. 

EVANSTON, ILLINOIS – SEPTEMBER 30: Olumuyiwa Fashanu #74 of the Penn State Nittany Lions in action against the Northwestern Wildcats during the second half at Ryan Field on September 30, 2023 in Evanston, Illinois. (Photo by Michael Reaves/Getty Images)
The Tennessee Titans have Calvin Ridley after signing him in free agency, so they pass on drafting a stud receiver in favor of tackle Olu Fashanu, who is going to be a beast for their offensive line.

Oct 28, 2023; Tucson, Arizona, USA; Oregon State Beavers offensive lineman Taliese Fuaga #75 walks off the field against the Arizona Wildcats at Arizona Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Zachary BonDurant-USA TODAY Sports
After signing Kirk Cousins to pair with all of their high-end skill on offense, they hope that Oregon State offensive lineman Tailiese Fuaga can help them off the line. 

Dec 2, 2023; Atlanta, GA, USA; Alabama Crimson Tide linebacker Dallas Turner (15) celebrates after a sack in the second quarter against the Georgia Bulldogs in the SEC Championship at Mercedes-Benz Stadium. Mandatory Credit: John David Mercer-USA TODAY Sports
The Bears pass on taking a stud receiver now that they have DJ Moore and Keenan Allen at the top of their receiver depth chart. They improve their pass rush with Alabama's Dallas Turner instead.

Sep 4, 2021; Atlanta, Georgia, USA; Alabama Crimson Tide offensive lineman JC Latham (65) blocks against the Miami Hurricanes at Mercedes-Benz Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Dale Zanine-USA TODAY Sports
The New York Jets need help with their offensive line. They get it with tackle JC Latham, who is ready to make an impact coming out of Alabama. 

Michigan quarterback J.J. McCarthy warms up before the national championship game at NRG Stadium in Houston on Monday, Jan. 8, 2024.
Kirk Cousins is not coming back to the Vikings as he is headed to the Falcons. Minnesota responds by shocking the world and drafting Michigan quarterback J.J. McCarthy with the 12th overall pick. The defending National Champion will be the guy they look to develop. 

Jan 1, 2024; New Orleans, LA, USA; Washington Huskies wide receiver Rome Odunze (1) warms up before playing against the Texas Longhorns in the 2024 Sugar Bowl college football playoff semifinal game at Caesars Superdome. Mandatory Credit: John David Mercer-USA TODAY Sports
After the Keenan Allen trade and a few other free-agency transactions, the receiver market shifted a little bit. The Broncos aren't upset as they select Rome Odunze with the 12th overall pick. He will be the replacement for Jerry Jeudy, who they traded to the Browns. 

Michael Wade/Icon Sportswire via Getty Images
After losing Amik Robertson in free agency, the Raiders target cornerback in the first round with Toledo's Quinyon Mitchell.

Aug 27, 2022; Tallahassee, Florida, USA; Florida State Seminoles defensive end Jared Verse (5) lines up against Duquesne Dukes offensive lineman Chris Oliver (59) during the first half at Doak S. Campbell Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Melina Myers-USA TODAY Sports
The New Orleans Saints get Florida State star pass rusher Jared Verse. He could end up being one of the best players in the draft. 

Georgia tight end Brock Bowers (19) scores a touchdown during the second half of a NCAA college football game against Ole Miss in Athens, Ga., on Saturday, Nov. 11, 2023. Georgia won 52-17.
The Indianapolis Colts are looking for help on the offense. They get it by adding Georgia tight end Brock Bowers with the 15th overall pick. 

Nov 18, 2023; Ames, Iowa, USA; Texas Longhorns defensive lineman Byron Murphy II (90) celebrates sacking the Iowa State Cyclones quarterback during the game at Jack Trice Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Aaron E. Martinez-USA TODAY Sports
The Seattle Seahawks improve their defensive line by drafting Byron Murphy II with the 16th overall pick.

Sep 9, 2023; San Diego, California, USA; UCLA Bruins defensive lineman Laiatu Latu (15) battles against San Diego State Aztecs tight end Mark Redman (81) during the first half at Snapdragon Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Orlando Ramirez-USA TODAY Sports
The Jacksonville Jaguars improve their pass rush by selecting UCLA edge rusher Laiatu Latu at 17th overall. 

Jan 9, 2023; Inglewood, CA, USA; Georgia Bulldogs offensive lineman Amarius Mims (65) against the TCU Horned Frogs during the CFP national championship game at SoFi Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-USA TODAY Sports
The Cincinnati Bengals are always looking for good offensive line play. They get it when they take Georgia tackle Amarius Mims with the 18th overall pick. 

Nov 6, 2021; Minneapolis, Minnesota, USA; Illinois Fighting Illini defensive lineman Jer'Zhan Newton (94) reacts to a missed stop in the third quarter at Huntington Bank Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Matt Krohn-USA TODAY Sports
Aaron Donald is retiring from the NFL. The Los Angeles Rams won't truly replace a legend like that, but they need someone to come in and play that position. Jer'Zhan Newton out of Illinois should be that guy.

Nov 25, 2023; Columbia, South Carolina, USA; Clemson Tigers cornerback Nate Wiggins (2) smiles after breaking up a pass to South Carolina wide receiver Nyck Harbor (8) during the fourth quarter at Williams-Brice Stadium. Clemson won 16-7. Mandatory Credit: Ken Ruinard-USA TODAY Sports
The Pittsburgh Steelers select Clemson cornerback Nate Wiggins with the 20th overall pick. You know they will thrive with a player like him on their defense. 

Oct 14, 2023; Seattle, Washington, USA; Oregon Ducks offensive lineman Jackson Powers-Johnson (58) celebrates after the Ducks scored a touchdown against the Washington Huskies during the second half at Alaska Airlines Field at Husky Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Steven Bisig-USA TODAY Sports
The Miami Dolphins select Jackson Powers-Johnson to help them with their offensive line. He can play center or they could move him depending on what they feel they need. 

Dec 1, 2023; Las Vegas, NV, USA; Washington Huskies offensive lineman Troy Fautanu (55) celebrates after the Huskies scored against the Oregon Ducks during the first quarter at Allegiant Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Stephen R. Sylvanie-USA TODAY Sports
Jason Kelce, the greatest center who ever lived, has retired. It won't be an easy task to replace him, but they select Troy Fautanu with the 22nd overall pick to try and develop. 

Oct 21, 2023; Iowa City, Iowa, USA; Iowa Hawkeyes defensive back Cooper DeJean (3) looks on during the game against the Minnesota Golden Gophers at Kinnick Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Jeffrey Becker-USA TODAY Sports
The Houston Texans continue to improve their defense by adding Iowa cornerback Cooper DeJean with the 23rd overall pick. 

Sep 23, 2023; Tuscaloosa, Alabama, USA; Alabama Crimson Tide defensive back Terrion Arnold (3) carries the ball after an interception against the Mississippi Rebels during the second half of a football game at Bryant-Denny Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Butch Dill-USA TODAY Sports
With the 24th overall pick in the draft, the Dallas Cowboys select Alabama cornerback Terrion Arnold to shore up their defense.

Oct 28, 2023; Lawrence, Kansas, USA; Oklahoma Sooners offensive lineman Tyler Guyton (60) at the line of scrimmage against the Kansas Jayhawks during the game at David Booth Kansas Memorial Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Denny Medley-USA TODAY Sports
The Green Bay Packers give Jordan Love some extra help when they select Oklahoma tackle Tyler Guyton with the 25th overall pick. 

Nov 11, 2023; Chapel Hill, North Carolina, USA; Duke Blue Devils offensive lineman Graham Barton (62) before the game at Kenan Memorial Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Bob Donnan-USA TODAY Sports
The Tampa Bay Buccaneers select Duke offensive lineman Graham Barton with the 26th overall pick in the draft. He will help them shore up their pass protection. 

Dec 31, 2022; New Orleans, LA, USA; Alabama Crimson Tide defensive back Kool-Aid McKinstry (1) reacts after a defensive play against the Kansas State Wildcats during the second half in the 2022 Sugar Bowl at Caesars Superdome. Mandatory Credit: Andrew Wevers-USA TODAY Sports
Oh yeah! The Arizona Cardinals select cornerback Kool-Aid McKinstry out of Alabama with the 27th overall pick in the draft. He will help them in their secondary. 

Brian Thomas Jr 11 runs the ball as the LSU Tigers take on Texas A&M in Tiger Stadium in Baton Rouge, Louisiana, November 25, 2023.
The Buffalo Bills may have to replace Stefon Diggs, but we don't know that for sure yet. Drafting LSU wideout Brian Thomas Jr. with the 28th overall pick is a good start. 

Penn State defensive end Chop Robinson (44) celebrates after sacking Massachusetts quarterback Taisun Phommachanh in the first half of a NCAA football game Saturday, Oct. 14, 2023, in State College, Pa. The Nittany Lions won, 63-0.
The Detroit Lions select edge rusher Chop Robinson with the 29th overall pick in the draft. He will help them improve their defense. 

Nov 25, 2023; Tempe, Arizona, USA; Arizona Wildcats offensive lineman Jordan Morgan (77) against the Arizona State Sun Devils during the Territorial Cup at Mountain America Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-USA TODAY Sports
The Baltimore Ravens may have an elite rushing attack once again. They select Arizona tackle Joe Morgan with the 30th overall pick in the draft to help them with that. 

Texas Longhorns wide receiver Adonai Mitchell (5) catches the ball for an first down against Kansas State Wildcats cornerback Jacob Parrish (10) in the. First quarter of an NCAA college football game, Saturday, November. 4, 2023, in Austin, Texas.
It would be fun to see the San Francisco 49ers attempt to give Brock Purdy another very good weapon. They are hoping that Adonai Mitchell becomes that when they make him the 31st overall pick in the draft. 

Sep 10, 2022; Austin, Texas, USA; Texas Longhorns wide receiver Xavier Worthy (8) catches a pass and lands out of bounds in the end zone against the Alabama Crimson Tide during the first half at Darrell K Royal-Texas Memorial Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Scott Wachter-USA TODAY Sports
Back-to-back Texas receivers in the draft? The Kansas City Chiefs, who can afford to take some risks, draft the fastest player in the draft by taking Xavier Worthy with the 32nd overall pick. He will work well for Patrick Mahomes opposite new wideout Hollywood Brown.

articles.title: Wisconsin HC Greg Gard remains one of the highest-paid coaches in college basketball
articles.author: Ben Kenney
articles.excerpt: Thoughts on Greg Gard being one of the highest-paid coaches in college basketball?
articles.summary:
Wisconsin head coach Greg Gard remains one of the highest-paid coaches in men's college basketball, according to an updated list recently published by USA TODAY.
The longtime Badgers coach is fresh off a somewhat disappointing 2023-24 regular season, especially after the team cratered over its final 11 games. That all is firmly in the rear-view now, however, as the Badgers are on an impressive Big Ten Tournament run and are currently set to face Illinois in the final.
Related: 
The public discussion surrounding Gard tends to shift with the result of each passing game. After Wisconsin's slide at the end of the season, many wanted him fired. Then after Wisconsin's 30-point win in the Big Ten Tournament, everyone praised him.
Wisconsin making its first Sweet 16 since 2016-17 would certainly push that sentiment toward the positive side after several years of postseason struggles.
Regardless of where that sentiment lands, Gard is undeniably a premier coach at a premier program, and is paid like it.
Here is where Wisconsin's head coach specifically ranks in USA TODAY's recent release of the top salaries in men's college basketball:

Feb 27, 2021; Lawrence, Kansas, USA; Kansas Jayhawks head coach Bill Self speaks about Kansas Jayhawks guard Marcus Garrett (0) after his team defeated the Baylor Bears at Allen Fieldhouse. Mandatory Credit: Amy Kontras-USA TODAY Sports
Salary: $9,625,642
Buyout: $23,100,000
All-time record: 809-247

Kentucky Head Coach John Calipari during an NCAA college basketball game between Tennessee and Kentucky in Knoxville, Tenn., Saturday, March 9, 2024.
Salary: $8,539,961
Buyout: $34,968,749
All-time record: 855-261

Jan 10, 2023; Madison, Wisconsin, USA; Michigan State Spartans head coach Tom Izzo talks to the referees during the first half against the Wisconsin Badgers at the Kohl Center. Mandatory Credit: Kayla Wolf-USA TODAY Sports
Salary: $6,196,169
Buyout: $7,000,000
All-time record: 705-293

Auburn Tigers head coach Bruce Pearl waves to fans after the game as Auburn Tigers take on Chattanooga Mocs at Neville Arena in Auburn, Ala., on Saturday, Dec. 30, 2023.
Salary: $5,716,652
Buyout: $14,635,417
All-time record: 442-217

Tennessee Head Coach Rick Barnes yells to the court during an NCAA college basketball game between Tennessee and Kentucky in Knoxville, Tenn., Saturday, March 9, 2024.
Salary: $5,700,000
Buyout: $18,175,000
All-time record: 803-413

Mar 21, 2021; Indianapolis, Indiana, USA; Baylor Bears head coach Scott Drew talks to forward Jonathan Tchamwa Tchatchoua (23) during a time out against the Wisconsin Badgers during the first half in the second round of the 2021 NCAA Tournament at Hinkle Fieldhouse. Mandatory Credit: Patrick Gorski-USA TODAY Sports
Salary: $5,132,832
Buyout: N/A
All-time record: 464-253

Connecticut Huskies head coach Dan Hurley reacts to an official's call in the first half of the NCAA Big East Conference Tournament second round game between the Connecticut Huskies and the Xavier Musketeers at Madison Square Garden in New York City on Thursday, March 14, 2024.

Dec 22, 2022; St. Louis, Missouri, USA; Illinois Fighting Illini head coach Brad Underwood reacts as he talks to a referee during the second half against the Missouri Tigers at Enterprise Center. Mandatory Credit: Jeff Curry-USA TODAY Sports

Mar 9, 2024; Houston, Texas, USA; Houston Cougars head coach Kelvin Sampson holds the net after the Houston Cougars defeated the Kansas Jayhawks and win the Big 12 conference championship at Fertitta Center. Mandatory Credit: Troy Taormina-USA TODAY Sports

Feb 28, 2024; Oxford, Mississippi, USA; Alabama Crimson Tide head coach Nate Oats gives direction during the second half against the Mississippi Rebels at The Sandy and John Black Pavilion at Ole Miss. Mandatory Credit: Petre Thomas-USA TODAY Sports

Mar 14, 2024; Nashville, TN, USA; Texas A&M Aggies head coach Buzz Williams yells to the referee against the Mississippi Rebels during the first half at Bridgestone Arena. Mandatory Credit: Steve Roberts-USA TODAY Sports

Arkansas Razorbacks head coach Eric Musselman works the referees against South Carolina during their second round game of the SEC Men's Basketball Tournament at Bridgestone Arena in Nashville, Tenn., Thursday, March 14, 2024.

Indiana Head Coach Mike Woodson smiles during Senior Day festivities after the second half of the Indiana versus Michigan State men's basketball game at Simon Skjodt Assembly Hall on Sunday, March 10, 2024.

Feb 18, 2024; Los Angeles, California, USA; UCLA Bruins head coach Mick Cronin (right) talks with guard Brandon Williams (5) against the Utah Utes in the second half at Pauley Pavilion presented by Wescom. Mandatory Credit: Kirby Lee-USA TODAY Sports
